review.title: miserable overnight stay near SFO
review.reviewText: The room was not clean.  The AC had soaked the carpet.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: I would've given this hotel a better review if it weren't for the person who checked me in. She was completely rude. It seemed as if she was doing me a favor by checking me in. While she was checking me in, she made no eye contact, told me that she "needs" a credit card and ID in a stern voice, and charged me an additional $75 as a security deposit. I understand that hotels do charge people for a security deposit, but this person swiped my credit card without informing me why she swiped it. I think it's imperative to tell people that they're being charged money and to be given a specific reason as to why they are being charged. The room was nice, but the staff who checked me in was horrible.

review.title: Friendly and comfortable
review.reviewText: We booked this as a place to stay for one night after our flight from UK. We then had breakfast at 6 am and drove north to visit family in Oregon.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. Ground floor room and access was easy. We felt safe and secure.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel provided everything we wanted for our short stay. Wished we could have stayed longer and used the excellent swimming pool!
review.locationRemarks: We stayed here because we like La Quinta and it wasnear the airport. Easy to find (but needed our sat nav).

review.title: Ok for overnight

review.negativeRemarks: nothing its ok, maybe some different things for breakfast

review.title: A little rough around the edges

review.title: very nice and clean hotel. we loved it.
review.reviewText: the lady at the check in desk was very attentive and nice. they let us check in at 11, way earlier than 3pm so that was a plus. the pool was warm and clean so the kids had a blast in there. it was not to far from fisherman's Warf and the golden gate bridge. it took us about 20 minutes to get to our destinations which was ok for us because we saved so much money on hotels. the hotel was reasonably priced. and the breakfast had good variety. the kids loved the waffles. the room was cleaned everyday. I would recommend it if travelling to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: we had a domino's pizza about 7 minutes away and a great taco shop also about 5 minutes away. the airport and freeway were right around the corner.

review.reviewText: Wifi is a joke...... It will make you long for the old days of dialup!

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: Although, the facility was fairly clean and updated, the room had a really funky smell.  It was an odor somewhere between a bag of Fritos to an old gym sock.  I could not get that smell out of my head.  We were in an end of the hall room that lead to an outside door and the noise in the hallway was awful.  There was a constant slamming of doors that I suspect may have been the door to the outside.  The air conditioner/heater was extremely loud that it made trying to sleep almost impossible.  I do appreciate a "free breakfast', but this was just so-so.  Not a lot of choices, but it was okay to start the day. The staff working the breakfast seemed to hustle and were eager to please.  We only stayed one night, but I don't think I would book here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close and convenient to the city and the price was reasonable, so I guess you get what you pay for on this one.  The staff was lukewarm.
review.negativeRemarks: Check out the funky odors and maybe improve the heating/air system.
review.locationRemarks: We were in town for a Giants game and to do some shopping, so all of that is readily available.

review.title: Very handy to the freeway access and the airport.
review.reviewText: The hotel had access to a Denny's. The hotel clerk advised of many fine dining establishments a short drive away which we took advantage of.  I was going to take a swim but the pool had not been screened and there were a lot of leaves. The overall pool area though was nice and save the fact that it needed screening, I would have taken a dip. We did use the continental breakfast in the hotel. It was very good.
Got a room in the back building where the train passed every 20 minutes,  very lonely didn't felt safe because the door near the elevator was never locked.

review.title: Convenient Location to the Airport
review.reviewText: Stuck in the back building over the railroad tracks.  The shower curtain was disgusting -- smelled like mold and mildew the cleanliness of the bathroom was moderate at best.  The TV pixels were overused so funny shadows appeared.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport.  AC worked really well.  The beds were comfortable and the cleaning staff did a great job making the beds (kudos to them).
review.negativeRemarks: Teach friendliness to the frontdesk staff.  Change the shower curtains.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: 12 minute car ride to Golden Gate Bridge, park car all day for $7, then take bus into downtown San Fran.  5 minutes to airport, clean, breakfast was very good.  I would highly recommend.

review.title: Double charged
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel this weekend, selected the pay at the hotel feature from Expedia and ended up with two charges for my one stay. Expedia has not been helpful as the customer service rep that I spoke to on the phone HUNG up on me and I don't understand why I wasn't contacted by anyone about why I have two charges and how it would be resolved. Definitely do not recommend as this has turned me off to the capability of trusting any future stay.

review.title: Old run down hotel right off the freeway.

The hotel needs a renovation and the traffic noise was so bad because it is right off the freeway. I thought the cars were going right thru my room.  I asked to be away from the freeway but I was given the room next to the freeway.

The breakfast hrs are short and very crowded. The hotel is located beside the main highway and it was very noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Better breakfast menu and better coffee.

review.title: Walking distance to shopping and eateries.
review.reviewText: Room directly above mine was being worked on through the night.  Homeless man eating the "free" breakfast on the ground in from of my door.  The area is on the verge of looking to appear unsafe, limited parking available and fee to park was not disclosed by Expedia when I book this room.
This hotel was comfortable. It is few miles away from the train station. I would recommend anyone to go here.

review.title: Nice and clean
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel because of its lower rate, and I was so glad I did.  My room was very nice and clean with very comfortable beds.  It's easy to find, right off the 101 freeway, so I guess it could be a little noisy, but it didn't bother us at all.   I'll definitely stay here again when I visit SF.
To be honest, I was a little skeptic when I read the negative reviews about this hotel, but the stay proved me wrong. I think people should be more reasonable and fair when writing up any review.

review.title: Two buildings

It is right next to the freeway and the Windows don't do much to help, you can hear everyone walking up and down the hallway and people in the room above. There was mold growing in the bathroom, and the room could of been cleaner. It is the most reasonable priced hotel that we could find that was close to San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review La Quinta. We are in the planning process of doing just that. The breakfast area is going to be expanded with much more space and easier access to everything.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: I don't recommend this hotel.
review.reviewText:
Booked two rooms for family here (room 444 and 446 in a separate building from the lobby). This hotel falsely boasts a smoke-free atmosphere, but room 444 reeked of smoke. An employee who brought us new key cards because neither of ours worked for 444, explained that the whole building used to be designated for smoking, but remodeling, painting, changing everything didn't get rid of the smell. Also, other customers smoked just outside the entrance to this building, so we had to walk through a cloud of smoke to enter the building. In addition, room 446 had a shower head, but no shower system. Only the bath fawcet worked and there was no lever to switch over to shower (see photos attached). Room 444 did have a lever and the shower worked so we all shared the one. Finally, when she unplugged our iPad from the outlet in 444, there was popping sound and smoke and our daughter's hand was zapped and the electricity went out. Her thumb print was emblazoned onto the iPad charger and left tingling for several minutes. 

Of 5 different hotels in a variety of locations on the west coast on our trip, this was the most expensive and the most disappointing.

review.title: Fantastic

review.title: Reasonable for an overnight stay for the right pri
review.reviewText:
Met our expectations for a single night transiting through SFO. No frills hotel inn. Double beds for our family of 4 was fine but not great. Mattresses could use replacing. Dated interior room decor.  I wouldn't want to pay too much for this basic hotel. Hotel shuttle was also just adequate as we waited longer than most at the airport. Leaving the hotel was as expected with the shuttle bus leaving every 30 min. 2 stops to other hotels but the wait was minimal. 
Try and secure a room in the main hotel for convenience. The highway is close but the white noise from the AC unit certainly helped. There is a truck depot on another side of the property, which also could be an issue. 

The main draw for our family was the Denneys across the parking lot open 24 hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, mattresses,
review.locationRemarks: Very little nearby but a Denneys which is open 24 hours.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. I'm happy our location worked for you. We are all looking forward to updates to our rooms. The windows will be included so we will be able to silence the highway noise as well.

review.title: An average hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here with family overnight. So far their room looks average and so is their service. I didn't have my breakfast but it's included in your booking so I couldn't say much of it.

Front entrance is dirty; wash the concrete and clean up the doors.  The front desk is dull and guest can see the back office and supplies - unkept. Doors should be closed.  Odor in rooms; appears clean but feels dirty.  Beds mattresses are hard.  Questionable if carpets are steam cleaned and deodorized as pets do stay in rooms.   My pet goes crazy sniffing the carpets and bed ends. 

Elevator floors are dirty.  

I've stayed at 3 la Quinta inns and I have the same complaint noted above.  I stay because I sometimes travel with my pet. 

Hope you that these complaints as constructive and strongly recommend the attention to make custermers stay more pleasant.  Cleanliness goes a long way for returns.  Thank you. 
Thank you

review.title: An old town must!
review.reviewText:
We stayed here with 21 high school lacrosse players, traveling home and needing a hotel close to the airport since our flight left at 6am in the morning. The staff was wonderful, accommodating and got all of our kids and chaperons to the airport in plenty of time!

The hotel is modern and updated with a great seating area in between the two buildings that gives you a little break out area. Easy freeway access and local food is pretty close. We walked about 4 blocks to a wonderful Mexican bar that had a line out the door for food.  Of course we stopped there and got in line!!  

Will stay here again for sure!

review.title: Crowded and small beds
review.reviewText:
Me and more 3 friends stayied in this hotel for two nights. We were sharing beds cuz it's cheaper but the beds too small, definitely not a queen size bed as announced. Also the breakfast was crowed. The line to do a waffle had at least 15 ppl and there was nobody at least trying to coordinate the lines that were also a mess. When you have finally gotten your food, a new adventure began: find a table or kick someone of the table. 
We didnt spend much time in the hotel but these things bothered us.
Btw, the staff was helpful and friendly all the time. Thumbs up for them.

review.title: Uncomfortably unclean & stale
review.reviewText: I booked for one night as an interim accommodation and my first time using expedia. I chose LA Quinta because there is a really nice one near our home so I thought this may be the same. This hotel has a nice front facade and entry way however, unbeknownst to me there were two separate buildings to the hotel. The front looked decent however our room was in the rear building of the same lot...past railroad tracks and poorly lit. The building is old, unkept ad did not feel the safest. Our room was a double bed room. The decor looked like the pics however the room had a pronounced stale smell, small hairs throughout the bathroom floor, the sink area & toilet were dull as though they haven't beencleaned,the carpet did not have the crisp appearance of cleanliness and left the bottoms of my socks dingy. We were so uncomfortable and exhausted and just wanted to get through the night. Needless to say,we did not sleep underthe blankets. We slept in our pajamas and with hoodies covering our heads without disturbing the bedding.Obviously, we did not sleep well until we went to the Airport Marriott the next day.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Bill! I appreciate your review and my team is happy you enjoyed your stay.

review.reviewText: Great Hotel for traveling out of SFO airport. Shuttle every 30 minutes and long term parking available up to 7 days.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and modern rooms with comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast space is crowded and needs more room.

review.title: Poor dirty hotel next to freeway.
review.reviewText: Room not clean, sheets didn't look fresh. TV didn't work, then toilet would not flush due to a major clog. Moved to another room and it was also dirty and smelled. Not a 2 1/2 hotel but survey would not be accepted if I posted otherwise.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was decent for the price. Was further away from the sites then I expected. Bathroom was old and stained.

managementResponses.response: Hello and thank you for taking the time to review your stay at La Quinta In San Francisco Airport North. We're happy you enjoyed your stay.

review.title: Very convenient location!
review.reviewText: Friendly environment.  Clean rooms and comfortable beds!

review.title: Close to airport with free airport shuttle  bus.
review.reviewText: Close to airport with free airport shuttle  bus.Affordable price.There are 2 buildings. We were in rear building. So we had to walk to go to main building for breakfast (about equivalent of walking 1 block). Near expressway and a Denny's. Small outdoor pool. Free Wi-Fi.
review.negativeRemarks: There are 2 buildings. We were in rear building. So we had to walk to go to main building for breakfast (about equivalent of walking 1 block).
review.locationRemarks: Near expressway and a Denny's. Small outdoor pool. Free Wi-Fi.

review.title: Good hotel as per its price
review.reviewText: Overall it's was an average hotel based on the price paid. But some things were not up to mark like the low ceiling of the building, no refrigerator, and no oven.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good nearby airport and also San Francisco city.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: The personnel was very professional. I will come back. Breakfast was awesome. I like the room service.

review.title: Very close to public trans, clean and b-fast great
review.reviewText: We used the free hotel shuttle to SFO to access BART to city and tours. Great and economical way for seniors to see sights!  Bath was great for handicapped visitors. Staff very helpful. Overall great experience.
A brief overnight stay to get to airport early AM.

review.title: Quick stay
review.reviewText:
Me and some of my friends only stayed for one night and I only interacted with the women at the front dress and although she was quick and efficient she didn't seem too friendly. 
The room worked for the night no complains there.

review.title: Quick overnight by airport
review.reviewText: The room was in an annex that i had to cross railroad tracks to get to, long walk, had a hard time getting in the main door, the card wouldnt work, was about to walk back to main building but decided to jiggle the door itself hard and yes the door was not making a good connection until i shook it and then it worked, the room was clean and ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Make rooms in the annex cheaper and be up front about getting assigned an annex room! Make sure doors work properly.
review.locationRemarks: close to sfo

review.title: A good hotel near Airport
review.reviewText:
We stayed 3 night at this hotel.The location as mentioned is near the train tracks.We were in the adjacent building and didn't hear those "rapid trains" mentioned by others.The hotel has easy access to Hwy 101 and if you have a car
is easy to get to downtown San Francisco.This hotel is not a 5 star hotel and if you have the budget will be advisable to choose another one for triple price
review.positiveRemarks: Had a good breakfast, free parking and internet
review.negativeRemarks: Help customers that are in adjacent building and have no car with the luggage .
review.locationRemarks: Not to much to do around the hotel but if you have a car is easy access to 101.We enjoyed Pier 39 and the Palace of fine arts among other sites

review.title: nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and they offered a nice selection of juices, fruit, cereals and pastries, waffles for breakfast.  My only complaint is the noise level.   The hotel is not only close the the freeway and airport, but it is also close to a very noisy warehouse where there was a lot of rumbling of carts all night long.  The noise level detracted from the rest of the experience.

review.title: Would work in a pinch
review.reviewText: Room smelled like dog urine. They said the hotel was pet friendly, but, I hope that urine in the room is not what they meant. Also, there was a 24 hour place next door, loading rigs all night. Constant fork truck operation and backup alarms right outside the window all night.  Airport shuttle showed up late. Not somewhere I would use again, unless it was free.

review.title: Breakfast sucked but that isn't why you stay
review.reviewText: Good bed, room darkens nicely, fairly quiet,  Dennys right next door. AC might have been too good. Really kept the room cool. Near the airport  (for those that care) and about 10 miles from the embarcadero and fisherman wharf.

review.title: Nice and noisy.
review.reviewText: Hotel sits between highway 101 and a busy warehouse on the other.  South San Frncisco Main Street is a short walk away and has excellent restaurants.  It took two days to get the tap repaired in the bath but cold showers are invigorating!

review.title: Very accommodating
review.reviewText: We arrived about 4 hours prior to usual check-in time and were able to check in right away. The airport shuttle service and BART worked great. The room was spacious and clean with a good bed.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for commenting on your stay. I wanted you to know that the South San Francisco police are now monitoring the area along the rail line and moving the people out of that area.

review.title: Pricey and run down
review.reviewText:
A conveient hotel to the airport with a frequent shuttle. Staff are pleasant and room and bed are comfortable.

The hotel is a bit worn and its to buildings adjacent to a train yard. Some unsavory characters hanging about on the rail line soliciting patrons walking between the two buildings

Complimentary breakfast is cereal and waffles

A little pricey for what you get but its SF and a good place to crash if arriving late.

managementResponses.response: I'm so sorry about the wifi issues. I will check our systems and make sure they are back up to speed.

review.title: Avoid if you can.
review.reviewText: The hotel is split by railway tracks and if you're room is on the other side of the hotel you have to cross the railway tracks to get there. Also, the hotel wifi is very slow. I ran a speedtest on the network and was getting speeds of less than 600Kbps.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi

managementResponses.response:
Jr..

Thank you for letting me know about your carpet. We are in the process of cleaning all of the carpets room by room. I will send my maintenance tech in to check your ac and refrigerator right away.

review.title: One night stay only
review.reviewText: The hotel has 2 buildings, they both are close the the railway so you can hear the train passing by. The carpet in the room was dirty, the a/c and minifridge were noisy.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the review of your stay at our hotel. I'm very happy you had a good stay. We look forward to your next stay at our La Quinta.

review.title: A good stay
review.reviewText: There was a great selection of breakfast options. The gym was nice and cool with good equipment and with good TV viewing in the gym. The shuttle that took us to the airport was quick and easy. The Denny's next door was nice and convenient. The cab ride to the main tourist part of SF was only 20 minutes or so. The service at check in was slow but all in all it was a good stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for reviewing my hotel. My houseman was spoken to right after your stay to be sure he includes daily cleaning of the fitness room.

review.title: Ok place to spend the night
review.reviewText: This hotel is within budget if you want to just spend the night before your trip to SFO or if you want to catch a flight in the morning. They have two buildings where the second building is a couple minutes walking from the first. Gym was not clean and there was so much dust.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments on your stay. Please know that we currently have a company in the hotel deep cleaning all of our carpets room by room. I will pass on you compliment to the staff.

review.title: Eewww
review.reviewText:
Staff are great
Cleanliness is so so
Took shoes off and as I stepped on carpet eewwww!!!! Sticky. 
Next to freeway so very noisy all night 
Bring earplugs if staying here

managementResponses.response: I'm sorry we are looking a little shabby. Since I came in as the new manager we are regrouping from a very busy time and deep cleaning the rooms including the carpet and as permitted washing the exterior of the building to remove the highway and airport grime. We will be much brighter very quickly.

review.reviewText: THE HOTEL LOOKS AND FEELS SHABBY.  THE BREAKFAST WAS A BIG NEGATIVE.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments. The parking is something I am working on with Denny's and also the tour bus company's. I want to make sure our driving guests have convenient easy access to parking.

review.title: Ok for the price!
review.reviewText: Needs more parking spaces because Denny's has too many reserved spots.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great - near SF airport and San Bruno Mall off El Camino Real.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee & Juice should be available 24/7 in lobby area.

managementResponses.response: Excellent!  We look forward to welcoming you again. Thank you for sharing.

review.title: Stay HERE
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a rural area. Looks like factory areas. Once you get to the corner where hotel is located, you see a Dennys (which is open 24hrs!) Hotel staff is friendly and fast. The rooms are great!! small pool, but good. I will definitely stay here again! Clean, nice size rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: location.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco!!

managementResponses.response: I am so sorry for this experience. It is not what La Quinta is known for nor is it something I allow from my team. I came to this hotel as the new manager about the time you stayed with us. Please be assured, rudeness is not tolerated and cleaning the rooms properly is worked on daily.

review.title: Front desk staff were rude when we picked up keys
review.reviewText: Room had dirty floors in bathroom and roaches in drawer but they did bring extra pillows that I needed for my bad knee and back when we picked up keys all she said was here she did eventually tell us where our room was after we asked but never did tell us breakfast hours or where it was

review.title: We left early......
review.reviewText:
If you like mold in the shower, curly hair in the shower (before anyone in your party takes a shower), uncomfortable beds and a train track right next to your hotel, this is the place for you! 

Not to mention the hotel is in 2 different sections, so if you are in the section in the back, you have quite a walk across railroad tracks to the pool and breakfast. 

We actually cut our vacation short by a day because my kids hated it so much. The only redeeming quality is it is conveniently located next to the freeway.

review.title: Move in day for my dtr to start college.
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay while we move in my daughter for college and considering you're on a tight budget found LQ to be very affordable and complimentary breakfast helped a lot. Will definitely recommend LQ!

review.title: Close to Costco for gas and freeways
review.reviewText: Good stay best sleep I had on our trip.easy access to freeways. Breakfast was good.

review.title: Charged my credit card multiple times!
review.reviewText: When I checked in the front desk person ended up charging my credit card 5 times... which made my credit card no good/denied.  What a mess.... I did call the credit card company in the morning and got it settled, but what a mess....  Also no hot water in the shower in the am...
review.negativeRemarks: knowledgeable front desk people
review.locationRemarks: Near airport... 10 miles to SF.

review.title: I asked for a2 queen size beds. I was given 2 full
review.reviewText: Hotels carpet very dirty. Restrooms. Very small .cleanliness needs improvement

review.title: bad
review.reviewText: I arrived late from the SFO. They had given my room to another party and had no vacancies.  This required me to search for another hotel room at midnight in a town strange to me.  I Demand compensation.
review.negativeRemarks: servive

review.title: Hotel requires improvements
review.reviewText: Was not a pleasant stay, unfortunately I will not return to any La Quinta.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, right next to industrial building
Bathroom, shower,hot water faucet fell off
Breakfast room unorganized, poordesigns
review.negativeRemarks: Move to another location

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText: Checked in, had a really bad room.  Mildew on tub and what appears to be mold on the ceiling above the tub.  Complained and was given another room.  The hotel is old and in serious need of upgrades.  The 1970's is looking for it's rooms.  The carpet was in good condition.  The parking here is horrible, the hotel allows people to park cars here while they fly out of SFO.  This makes parking a real hassle.  Noticed during my stay of four nights at least nine or ten cars that did not move!  Okay for a one night airport stop, not the several day vacation.  Many hotels in area, would leave this on do not bother list.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport that I did not use.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms period.

review.title: Hotel ok-close to airport.
review.reviewText:
We found a pair of men's undergarment in our "clean" room upon our arrival. Notified hotel staff and they were apologetic and credited our bill for one night. 
Had a reservation and upon trying to check in at 8:30 pm we had to wait 40 minutes for a clean room, then our room was missing the fridge. 
Offers a very nice complimentary  breakfast. 
Crowded parking lot.
good stay--windows dirty. room maids good-- desk staff very disappointing

review.title: Clerk
review.reviewText: He was delightful considering he was the only person to check in a large crowd.  Walking to the North building at night was not comfortable, he did offer to have someone walk with us.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the shuttle running before 4AM
review.locationRemarks: Did not use any

review.title: decent place , a little cramped, ok breakfast. Fai
review.reviewText: Good place. Decent location, free breakfast was ok. Comfortable bed. I would reccommend.

review.title: Non-smoking room reeked of smoke
review.reviewText:
I had to spend the night in San Francisco because of flight issues and I was looking for something not so expensive (but not cheap) and found this hotel. The person at the front desk was very nice, but the hotel was just sad. My room smelled so badly of smoke that I had to make coffee just to smell something else, there were burns on the carpet and the bathrooms had hairs and signs of not-so-great cleaning job. I almost wanted to ask the front desk to give me a refund and go back to sleep at the airport, but I was so tired... 

The A/C couldn't even be adjusted or turned on or off, I had to unplug it... The only thing that was kind of OK was the breakfast, just the usual, but good.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell, please wash those carpets and clean better.
review.locationRemarks: Not much nearby, just a Denny's across the parking lot.

review.reviewText: Bathroom has too many molds. We stayed for 2 nights and no one cleaned the room, did not change towels and linens. Carpets on the hallways were dirty with lots of tiny pieces if white thingy that are so visible but no one vacuumed them...

review.title: Excellent place to enjoy your trip
review.reviewText:
Great sevices, excellent breakfast, pool, jacuzzi.
Very clean, frienly staff, good parking location.
review.locationRemarks: hotel was near SFO shopping location and destinations.

review.title: Wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: Close proximity to downtown San Francisco. In a sketchy area. Small uncomfortable beds. Didn't provide the microwave and refrigerator I paid and booked for.

review.title: San Francisco 2015
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find. Close to a Denny's. Check in and out was easy. Room was a little small and lacked any "bonuses" of our last hotel of a refrigerator and a microwave but it nicely decorated and clean. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We were in the annex of the hotel although technically not connected which made getting to the free breakfast a little inconvenient. Close to the freeways. Near train tracks but I did not hear any trains during my 2 day stay. Free parking, Free Wi-Fi and free breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Wi-Fi, free parking, free breakfast. Very nicely decorated and clean. Nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not particularly like being in the "other" part of the hotel. We had to drive there from check in as well as back for breakfast every morning.
review.locationRemarks: We were close to the freeway to San Francisco. Staff was able to direct us to anywhere we needed to go. Denny's shared the parking lot.

review.title: Ok hotel, ok price.
review.reviewText: Basic, clean hotel. Close distance to SFO airport and about 20 minutes to San Francisco. Main problem is parking, specially after 8pm. Parking lot is share with other bussiness and spaces are marked accordingly. The hotel does not have have many parking slots for them.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: It was an ok place hard to get in and out of.  Not the most friendly staff.

review.title: Convenient hotel but very noisy and not very clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located next to a freeway and a bunch of restaurants but there is a lot of noise from that freeway which makes it difficult to sleep. Also the bathroom had a smell of urine and the floor was sticky, which was really dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the bathroom, please.

review.title: First and last!!
review.reviewText: No a pleasant stay. First time at this hotel and very disappointed

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: I wasn't either totally impressed, nor completely dissatisfied with our one-night stay at this hotel. Our room was clean and bed was comfortable. Was pleasantly surprised we had a microwave and small fridge. We noticed that we didn't have any soap in the bathroom to wash our hands. I called front desk and requested some and got an attitude from the woman who answered the phone. I didn't dare want to ask whether we were supposed to have the typical complimentary lotion/shampoo/etc. The shuttle to the airport was fine. All in all our stay was a good one, but would appreciate friendlier staff.

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Great stay. Nice comfy room. Close to the airport.
Hotel approx 20 minutes away from downtown.  Advantage was parking.

review.title: Close to airport and clean
review.reviewText: I had to check in very late and the staff was accommodating .
Stay was OK for the price Next time I would look harder for a better hotel
review.negativeRemarks: yes you need to make smoking areas better No matter what you think of smoking some of your cust. do smoke

review.title: Worst la Quinta ever
review.reviewText:
Poor experience 
Can not believe that la Quinta lets this hotel use it's brand name

review.title: Very close to the airport but clkse to train track
review.reviewText: This hotel was a wonderful hotel for us. They had a shuttle that got us to to airport and even let us park our car free of charge (as long as it was less than 10 days). I do wish the shuttle went for longer because when we returned we had to get w can. Their last one arrives at the airport at 12:22 and we got their at 12:30. We were able to quickly check in. The room was clean but with very minimal toiletries(soap, shampoo and conditioner in one). The only down fall was that the hotel is right next to a train track and you are able to hear the train go by throughout the night so bring ear plugs and you should be fine. They do also offer a continental breakfast. I did not eat there to see what it was like but it smelt good.

review.title: Great stay for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel is great for the price. The only thing we had seen is there was hair in the shower drain so it drained real slow. The last morning I took a shower and it didn't drain. He didn't say anything about it til we checked out. Other then that, if you come in late. It's really hard to find a parking spot. But it's still a good stay for price. Breakfast is decent.

review.title: No parking, kirt staff, near airport, well worn
review.reviewText: If you get in late, good luck getting parking. Getting in and out of the lot is an equal nightmare - ten pounds of building in a five pound piece of property. The staff is snippy but proficient and got the job done. The place isn't dirty, but has that overall feeling of grimeyness, one that is compiled over decades of wear. This is not the Ritz. However, it gets the job done at a relatively reasonable price given its close proximity to the airport. (If your needs do not include the airport, look elsewhere)

review.title: We survived
review.reviewText: It's a bed lodged between active Railroad tracks, with a big produce warehouse loading semi trucks graveyard shift between 2 freeways next to the airport, couldn't get enough towels, people fighting over free breakfast and I ended up with food poison from the Denny's in the front parking lot. You decide from there. You get what you pay for.
Carpets need to be cleaned, a little smelly. Also should invest in more than 1 washer and dryer

it was our 1st time to stay at La Quinta, and overall I would say that we were happy with the accomodation.  breakfast was not totally ok because there were only few choices, i was hoping to see sausage, eggs and bacons.  room as ok too, it was clean and the lobby was not smelly as compared with other hotels that we stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: room was clean, lobby was not smelly(no cigarette smell)
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast selection(would like to see sausage, bacons and eggs)
review.locationRemarks: when the lady at the reception told us that the location of our room was at the back, I thought it was strange, because there was a railway.

review.title: Good hotel just to pass the night
review.reviewText: good hotel to spend the night, the breakfast is the same after the 3rd day you don't want to eat

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: Not bad for what I paid for.  Staff were really friendly.  Breakfast wasn't too bad.  The only thing I had a problem with was parking.  Limited parking space.   Most of the time I had park far.  Overall it was good.

review.title: Very nice and close to the city!
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed her for the weekend it was a nice size for two people and beds were perfect size for each of us! Will definitely be staying here again and I felt safe in the neighborhood.

review.title: lovely hotel and very nice staff
review.reviewText: this was the last destination on our road trip and thankfully, we booked our room for two nights in San Francisco because it was the most comfy room with the best beds on our whole trip.  Hotel staff was extremely kind and accommodating too.  I slept so good and the room was nice and clean too.  Really didn't want to leave.
review.positiveRemarks: the room, the bed, hotel service and room service selections, Denny's restaurant right in front that is open 24 hours a day.
review.locationRemarks: the hotel has a shuttle that takes you to the BART station, which opens up any location in the bay area, but also near shopping centers and restrnts

review.reviewText: I and my wife stayed there for 4 nights. This was our first time to SFO and this was the reasonably cheap hotel in this area with breakfast. Very close (3 miles) from airport car rental centre. There are few good restaurants and also Target within 1.5 mile radius. Check-in was pretty quick, the hotel staff were good. Parking was easy with ample space in front of the entrance. The hotel itself is a very old one, the entryway carpets are old and stained. The room was fairly big and had all basic amenities, but the curtains, carpet and the sofa was really really old. Breakfast was reasonable, they have freshly made waffles, cereal, muffins, bagels, juices, coffee and hard boiled eggs. I think for this pricey city, this hotel met my expectations for the price.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with an excellent staff.   It is close to SFO.  It used to be my automatic choice until the chain doubled their prices - which seem to be coming down a bit.  This selection was from the Expedia blind choice.    The only major issue with the hotel is that many of the rooms are very noisy - it is between 101, Caltrain and a warehouse.   The rooms on 101 are intolerable.   If you don't might the noise, everything else about this hotel is excellent and I'd rate it a 4 or 5.   The staff accommodated me in one of the quieter rooms and I was highly satisfied with my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything but the noise (which I did not experience due to room choise)
review.negativeRemarks: other than moving it to a quieter location, not much
review.locationRemarks: easy to get everywhere from here with car

review.title: Close to airport close to eatery
review.reviewText: Rating hotel a little overpriced for what you get

Shuttle was packed because of laybor day weekend. There was only ONE representative when we arrived. Me and my 4 years old son waited standing 40 mins to check in and when we got to our room, it was past 11:30pm. It made our stay shorter because we had to take 9am shuttle back to the airport.

review.title: Not fancy but it was nice enough
review.reviewText: Stayed at La Quinta Inn to be close to the airport.  The location is a little weir--right off the freeway and by an industrial complex but it worked for our purpose.  Close to the airport and an easy drive into the city.  The overall accommodations were not fancy but they were nice enough for a short stay.  Complimentary breakfast was better than expected--waffle bar, fruit, cereal and a better variety than just danish and toast like so many other complimentary breakfasts.  Reasonable rates for San Francisco so I would recommend if you're looking for a place for a short stay.

review.title: The whole experience is terrible.
review.reviewText: The service of staff is awful.She didn't ask me the info of my car even when she knew my car could be towed! The beds are small and all the facility are old. The worst part is the location of the hotel: it is really noisy!

review.title: Great hotel for a layover at SFO
review.reviewText:
Shuttle runs every 30 minutes so very short wait to hotel. Not much to eat close by but there is a Danny's right next door.  The facility is clean enough but showing its age a bit.  Be aware the shower in room 430 is reversed cold is hot and hot is cold.
   The hotel worked for what I needed it to do.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Excellent access to SFO/BART and reasonably priced
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was way too soft

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
Our room had 2 double beds in it which were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was a little old and the taps were unusual to work to say the least. They had to be turned on and off in some sort of order to work...I never really figured it out but somehow managed to get a hot shower.
Denny's is just outside the hotel and is the only eating place close by. I found a great Thai restaurant about 10 minutes walk away and there were a number of other eating places within a 10 minute walk.
The hotel guest laundry was good and a very large load of washing and drying could be done for around $6.
The breakfasts were substantial with plenty of variety including 3 cereals, oatmeal, yoghurt, fresh fruit (choice of 3) coffee, juices, waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, muffins etc etc
The staff were very friendly and helpful and the free shuttle was great. The driver was fantastic both times.
There were plenty of towels etc which were big and fluffy.
review.negativeRemarks: There could be more tables and chairs in the breakfast room. The bathroom needs a lot of renovating and repairing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, walking distance to a variety of eating places and small shops.

review.title: Corridor carpets could use cleaning and deodorizin
review.reviewText: Very hard to spot bulding 10 after dark. Unpleasant odors in the corridors. Carpets need cleaning more often.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location Though the outer buildings need better numbering. Building 10 was hard to find awY in the rear.
review.negativeRemarks: Grabbars in the tubs.

review.title: easy access to airport
review.reviewText: clean, older hotel with easy access to the airport and the BART subway
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport with shuttle service
review.negativeRemarks: better shower fixtures
review.locationRemarks: easy to connect to BART at the airport

review.reviewText: We booked this hotel on a short notice on expedia and the overall expiernce was great!

Tired, after a long day, they had my reservation listed wrong, and took 20 minutes to find it after I insisted.  Not a good way to begin.  The security had trouble being found to "walk" me over the other "other" hotel across the tracks (literally...).  Otherwise, the shuttle to the airport came only a few minutes late, and it was very close to the airport.  Hairs in the bathroom, but I ignored them....
Staff was nice, breakfast was average.  I had a early evening flight and I was able to check out later than the 12pm check out time.  Shuttle to airport every half hour and on time.

review.title: Avoid this place!
review.reviewText: Terrible place. Two buildings and the walk to the second building is a hike. The room was vey dated, the shower was dirty and the towels were see through. The room itself was small and the furniture scratched, dented dirty. Serioulsly even though it was inexpensive by SF standards pay more and stay in a better place. Not hard to do.

review.title: Quiet hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Close to downtown South San Francisco. Easy access to the freeway and about 20 minutes to downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the rooms had a small refrigerator. Too bad the pool/jacuzzi are outdoors. Its to cold and windy to use them.

review.title: Basic ok for airport you get what you  pay  for

review.positiveRemarks: It had a bed for the night
review.negativeRemarks: Most things

review.title: the hotel is not good

review.positiveRemarks: The Room is nice,and clean,the front desck people are good.
review.negativeRemarks: Security in the night between the 2 buildings
review.locationRemarks: This is the main thing ,cause the raíl roads divide the hotel and for me,I don't like It.they not count Whit lose and found,I lose My cap.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: The rate was good for near the airport.  Room has not been shown some TLC for a while.  Tub bottom was discolored, mirrors were peeling at the bottom.  Some hair on floor, and towels stained.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, more breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: good location to airport, that s all
review.reviewText:
back building is old and very poor condition hidden across the railway tracks.
There are many better options in the area comparatively priced

review.title: Overpriced for what you get!
review.reviewText: I put in a reservation for a King size bed and got 2 doubles.  The shower didn't work and the tub did not have a stopper.  Carpet stained.  Ice bucket did not have a liner.  Noisy hallway.
Was clean Breakfast adequate could have been better.  Need frigs in rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Put frigs and microwaves in the double rooms

review.title: Excellent stay for the value
review.reviewText: Room was clean, bathroom was nice, bed was comfortable, room was quiet, complimentary breakfast was good. Very reasonable rate for the room.
review.positiveRemarks: close to San Francisco but room rates are good, including a complimentary breakfast for a more relaxed start in the morning, and parking is free.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco area has a ton of things to do

review.title: Nice economical stay for visiting the bay area
review.reviewText:
The building is old, but clean. The surroundings aren't great that there's a warehouse that probably handle produce seems operating 24 hours. It's right next to the freeway. However, the noise wasn't bad.
The size of the room and the bathroom is fairly compact, but usable.
It's in South San Francisco, the industrial city therefore the surrounding is not like residential or corporate areas.
Expecting you're not staying at 4 or 5 star hotel, or one of the newest facilities, it was a pleasant place to stay.
They serve breakfast and they replenish the food as people consume. So there's plenty of food for the breakfast.
My wife was concerned with the bad reviews on the place, but she felt positive about the stay after the trip.
review.positiveRemarks:
The room rate.
Breakfast
Staff response

review.title: Very old hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel set-up is strange to say the least.  Walking past the truck facility over the railroad tracks is not the best, did not feel safe doing so.  The room had a very funky smell, thinking it was the air unit.  Hotel is old, not that well maintained or clean.  Between the freeway traffic and the train the noise is very loud. Will not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms, clean all air units.  Better lighting to back building.
review.locationRemarks: Denny's next door that's about it

review.title: Friendly staff and clean but noisy
review.reviewText: Staff very nice and friendly but electric plugs in bathroom did not work and wasn't able to dry hair. Too noisy as it is close to the airport.
My room was in the back building & I had to lug my suitcases across the parking lot & across the train tracks. Didn't expect that.

Old hotel/motel property. Two separate buildings in a not so nice part of town. As a woman traveling alone, was shocked they put me in the back building. It was a little scary walking across the railroad tracks to the main building in the DARK!. My room had that terrible smell of old/stale cigarette smoke - probably from years ago. Fitness center was filthy and did not have much equipment. I will not be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Fitness center, smell in room.
review.locationRemarks: Fly in an out of SFO.

review.reviewText: Very hard to find parking not many spaces available in that location  but is close to freeway entrance and just a few minutes from airport

review.title: Perfect hotel next to airport
review.reviewText: I enjoyed a 10 night stay, ample breakfast, comfortable sleep, superb internet, and sufficient parking. With Denny's at your doorstep, you got it all
You get what you pay for. Medium rate, medium service.

review.title: DO NOT STAY!
review.reviewText: HOTEL IS CONVENIENT TO AIRPORT BUT NOT WORTH IT. THOUGH THE BEDS WERE MADE; SOILED BEDDING STUFFED IN CLOSET. THE BATHROOM WAS DIRTY AND NO TOILETRIES AVAILABLE. COMPLAINED AND THEY CUT BILL IN HALF BUT RECEIPT REFLECTED ORIGINAL PRICE. WAITING TO SEE IF THEY CREDITED CREDIT CARD. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.
review.negativeRemarks: CLEANLINESS.
review.locationRemarks: CONVENIENT TO AIRPORT

review.title: Overnight to catch a plan in the AM
review.reviewText:
We booked this room as part of travel plans to mexico.  We had to stay overnight in San Francisco for a flight in the AM to Mexico.  I wanted to make sure  we had a shuttle to hotel as we arrived at midnight and breakfast in the AM.  This aspect of the the hotel  services was fine.  

However, our room was about as far away from  check in as possible and it was even in a separate building across a street and railroad tracks.  Also, the building was right under the interstate. 

Our room was dirty in a variety of areas.  The doors near the handles were grimy. The bathroom wall next to the shower where there was a towel hook had drips of dirt  as someones hands were very dirty and placed a towel on the hook and dripped on the wall.  

The cold and hot water facets in the shower were broken and loose.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle and breakfast, close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: As above

review.reviewText: The first room was really dirty and smelled awful.  There was lots of mold in both the bathrooms we were assigned to!  Courteously the staff moved us to a different room in the main building.  The new room was better taken care of and smelled nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor desperately needs an update, make cleanliness a priority

review.title: Close to airport, but that's about it
review.reviewText: The staff, including desk and breakfast staff were unfriendly to almost rude. The shuttle was on time, but went on "rounds" unexpectedly adding 10 minutes. Breakfast was barely ok. Room was acceptable. Next time I'll take my chances with another place.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the 101 and  airport.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for a week to visit relatives.  The only comment I have is that the breakfast is heavy of the carbohydrates.  If you want something different the Denny's is across the parking lot.  There is a freeway on one side and a produce warehouse on the other side.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a good value with nice accomodations.
review.negativeRemarks: While the breakfast is acceptable that would be the thing that could possibly be improved by adding a meat option.
review.locationRemarks: The location for us was very good because it was close to our relatives.  We did go to the top of the San Bruno Mountain Park with a picnic.

review.reviewText: Very shabby hotel. Don't recommend it unless you can get it at dirt cheap prices.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Everything was fine except that when we arrived there was hair on the bathroom floor.  We called the front desk and they sent someone promptly to clean the floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds and convenient to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport where we were able to take the BART train into the city.

review.title: SEE MY OTHER REVIEW.  THIS PLACE IS A DUMP!
review.reviewText: THIS PLACE IS A DUMP!  STRIPPED COLD WATER FAUCET IN SHOWER, MILDEW IN SHOWER, FLOORS NASTY.  PLUS THEY HAD NERVE TO ASK FOR A $90.00 DEPOSIT IN WHICH I WAS NEVER TOLD ABOUT AND THEY STILL HAVE NOT PUT THE $90.00 BACK ONTO MY CREDIT CARD.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: front desk was very helpful.  the beds were amazing, very comfortable, clean, loved the comforters, slept well.  temperture was nice and just a nice room, thank you,staff very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: just the coffee pots  in the room
review.locationRemarks: we took the bart to downtown san francisco and saw everything you could see

review.title: La Quinta
review.reviewText: Nice hotel convenient to air and rail transportation hubs.  Free shuttle to SFO.

review.title: Close to airpory
review.reviewText: Had a decent stay.check in was fast staff was very helpful

review.title: business trip
review.reviewText: great location, got a quiet room on ground floor. very closed to restaurant row on Grand Ave.
review.positiveRemarks: assign to a quiet room is the KEY
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: Proximity to the airport is the best part.
review.reviewText: Room was dirty and smelled like a gym locker room.

review.title: La Quinta Experience
review.reviewText: Average aging hotel but with free airport shuttle and free high carb breakfast its a good bet. Rooms are a bit dated and could use a facelift. A nice shower, unfortunately the shampoo was not included. Again, it is still a "best buy." Plan to save well over a $100 a night at a "closer in" hotel, and still reasonably convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Its an average hotel. No more, no less.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire hotel smelled a bit old and looked a bit dated. The breakfast is not for diabetics! Almost entirely carbohydrate and very little protein.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO Airport and the BART. Go anywhere from there!

review.title: Comfortable and pleasant airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 10 days as it was near our daughters home and only needed a bed for the night. Was unexpectedly good, breakfast was provided, self service buffet including waffle maker, microwave, toaster etc.
Nice clean room, linen changed daily, we even had our sheets turned down in the evening!
Shame it was out of season as there was a nice outside pool with loungers.
review.negativeRemarks: Only minor complaint was attitude of airport Shuttle service driver, very rude to my husband and broke the wheel of our suitcase lifting out of bus.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to the Caltrain so easy to get into San Fran city. Dennys next to hotel.

review.title: Just good hotel close to the SFO airport
review.reviewText: They can Improve the breakfast a little more.  And some front desk staff need to be more diligent.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText:
Check in: I think the person helping us was new. It took longer than usual to check in and had to wait for another staff member to help her. She was very polite though.

Room: For the price we paid, the room wasn't that bad. It did its job. The only thing I would say is when the heater is on, it makes a little rumbling noise and there was a little bit of rust in the bathroom.

Location: I loved how it was conveniently next to the 101 freeway so it was easy to get back and forth to the northern area of San Francisco.  The only weird thing was the hotel has two buildings and we were located in the back, behind the railroad tracks, next to.. A warehouse? A little sketchy. 

Overall, not too bad if you're on a budget.

review.title: good for a night sleep
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly... wish breakfast was later, we were on vacation and couldn't enjoy sleeping in since breakfast was only from 7a-9a. Didn't like the fact that they double charged my card just because it was a debit card. All in all, right off the freeway, and next to dennys (since we missed breakfast) it was a good stay

review.title: walking to another building
review.reviewText: I found this very surprising to arrive by the airport shuttle, and then be given keys to a room in the building next door. I had to drag my bags across a railway track approaching the hotel to find my keys to the room did not work. Alone, tired, and frustrated to the fact there was  no house phone I had no other choice but to walk back to the main building. The staff were very polite, and apologetic but I have no doubts, I would of been given the same room again, if I had not refused to walk outside one more time. Thanks for the bottle of water. The room was pleasant, the breakfast was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle up to midnight. close to airport. breakfast was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Those who arrive by airport shuttle and are not driving, do not give them a room in the building next door.
review.locationRemarks: close to airport.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The room is clean and nice, close to freeway and airport

review.title: Never more
review.reviewText:
...very rude arogant personal.
In request I had non smoking and we got smoking room.Smell terrible!!!!
Open windows solution didn't work since right under window is very busy railroads  and airports nearby too.
We been told expedia request doesn't mean anything for them so they will not change our room.

review.title: Like a trip to Colorado
review.reviewText: Advertisement makes this chain desirable.  We come to SF twice a month.  Always wanted to stay here.  Not what I expected. We were given a room on the back property.  As soon as we entered the hotel lobby you could smell weed so thick it was sickening.  I thought it was a no smoking hotel. We were on the third floor and the smoke hadn't come up.  When we entered the room it smelled so musty and moldy that we had to open the windows and spray air freshener.  Beds were comfortable, breakfast not as pictured, access on and off the freeway easy.  Luckily there was a Dennys within walking distance.  Will not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Follow the no smoking policy, whether cigars, cigarettes or marijuana.  I don't do any of these and don't want to be subject to them.
review.locationRemarks: Withing walking distance to Denny's.  Great restaurants on Grand Ave.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: It was okay . Nice for a short stay like 1-2 days .
overall it's good , but one of the staffs wasn't very accommodating

Arrived at the hotel at 1pm and was told that check in was at 3 pm without checking the system. The next day noticed a customer trying to check in at 10 am and the hotel staff checked the system and found a room.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff helpful, shuttle timely both to and from airport.  There is a Denny's practically in the driveway and other restaurants within walking distance.  Breakfast was ample and good.
review.locationRemarks: near airport; restaurants nearby

review.title: passing through
review.reviewText: Suited our needs for the night. We were just passing through and needed a place close to the airport.

review.title: Last resort
review.reviewText: Stayed 1 night while in transit. Room had a mildew/musty smell. When I went to shower there was dirt in the tub. The only positive was that the bed was pretty comfortable.

review.title: Large comfy rooms, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Nice breakfast, free wifi, staff is great, rooms are surprisingly large, beds are soft and comfy.
Room smaller with less amenities than many. I would like microwave and frig in rooms.

review.title: Bathroom needs repairs!
review.reviewText: Bathroom suffered from neglect!  Faucet in tub would not shut off, causing water drip.  Ceiling fan was not cleaned in about a year, based on dust accumulated on surface.  Tub was lined with black mold.  Do not know if this was the norm for their rooms, but my son was in another room on the same floor and his bathroom had similar issues.  Room lacked a refrigerator and comfortable chair.
review.negativeRemarks: Regular maintenance of bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Location convenient to freeways.

review.reviewText: Nice and good service, nice and good service, nice and good service

review.title: Close to downtown san fransisco
review.reviewText: Had a great experience customers service was great good breakfast service

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Close to airport and Denny's on location is good. They have lack of parking and the corridors are smelly. It is clean but dated
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms and corridors are dated
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport but as usual id far from downtown or places of interest

review.title: Very nice hotel great location.
review.reviewText: Room was very clean and bed was comfortable.  Morning breakfast had good selection and there was plenty.  Front desk personnel were very accommadating.  Overall would stay again for sure!

review.title: Depends on duration of your stay
review.reviewText:
I have stayed  here for a period of 60 days continously and I will be absolutely honest about my review.

The duration of of your stay is most important whilst choosing this hotel. 

Positives:
1. The staff (front desk, maintenance, house keeping) are friendly,helpful and cooperative.
2. They offer complimentart breakfast
4. They have a Denny's restaurant in thier car park area ( 2mins walking) or less than that.
5. Nearby to the Airport ( Free shuttle service to airport provided by them with flexible timings) . If you take a  yellow cab it would take 10 -12 mins to reach the airport.
5. Free parking and always available

Negatives:
1. Their complementary breakfast is okay . It comprises of  cold boiled eggs, cereals , waffles( to be made on our own) , fruits (whole apples, oranges and bananas), Tea , coffee, very limited juices.They also have muffins and bread along with bread and butter. Thier breakfast timings on weekdays are from 6-8 am and  on Sat and Sun from 7-10 am. MAKE SURE YOU ARE ON TIME FOR BREAKFAST OR THEY SHUT OR REFUSE TO OFFER YOU.
2.They change bedsheets once in 3 days only and no exceptions to that.
3. Some rooms need to be noisy due to the highway traffic and railway tracks behind.
4. The hotel is located in an isolate place. Nearest shopping Mall called Tanforan you will have  to take a cab whoch cost 12-15$ depending on traffic. The hotel has supermarkets or anything nearby except Denny's.
5. The gym is terrible.
6. Expensive laundry in hotel
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff is freindly and helpful. 

Rooms have their own washrooms.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.Change the bed sheets on a daily basis.
2. Improve thier breakfast ; more options , hot boiled eggs
review.locationRemarks:
Denny's eating place - less than 2 mins walk.

 Nearest shopping Mall called Tanforan - cab 12-15$ each way

Hertz car rental 5- 8 mins walk

review.title: Marijuana smell
review.reviewText: Our room was great. We stayed two night total. However, there was a room down the hall partying, and the entire hallway reeked like marijuana for the two days. Why did this go unseen or why didn't it get taken care of?!

review.title: Ok but bathroom was gross.
review.reviewText: Staff was ok. Beds and bedding were good. TV only has few channels. No movies. Bathroom ceiling was molded and seeped through an attempt to paint over. Bathroom tub was covered by a gross covering and drain was completely rusted out.

review.title: Nice location! Nice rooms and close to downtown
review.reviewText: Great to have our two rooms together. Nice to enjoy a good breakfast and to have a helpful staff at the front desk.

review.title: Airport Layover
review.reviewText: Property is dated, needs to be updated as the rooms are small, bathroom fixtures old but for a short layover is adequate.
review.negativeRemarks: Fixtures, bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, not a lot of restaurants in walking distance except Denny's

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Good value hotel next to SFO with half hourly shuttles to airport. If you check in late in the day and don't want a handicap room you have to tell them at the desk.
Handy location, near the airport. Grand Ave. had the best burritos ever at La Tapatia!

review.title: hotel stay
review.reviewText: front desk were fast checking us in and courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: simple, clean very comfy and loved the continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: although we booked a free smoking section, our neighbors smoke was coming in through our bathroom vent.
review.locationRemarks: it's sort of centered and was easy to get around.

review.title: Good location, staff great.
review.reviewText: Good location, close to San Francisco.  Close to freeway.

review.title: Nice hotel at reasonable rates
review.reviewText: Staff very nice. Only thing is that we got the room in building next to train tracks. So it was a walk to breakfast area but not much of an issue.
Rooms were good.. but have to stay other building of their.

review.title: Good hotel close to San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Fine place to stay for a couple of nights.  Did not sample the breakfast but everything worked as promised.
review.positiveRemarks: Good rates and close to San Francisco Airport.

review.reviewText: Not in a good part of town.  Next door to a warehouse.  Did have security walking parking lot.  This is either a good thing or a bad thing.

review.title: Seen it's better days, hallways smell of pot!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Have been coming to this location for over 5 years, this property has been going down hill for awhile!!!! Hallways always have a very strong odor of pot and rooms are needing a serious update. Cost of rooms are high and not worth the money anymore. Pay the extra $25 to stay @ the Holiday inn across the freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Bust the people who smoke pot in their rooms

review.title: Not so clean room
review.reviewText: I don't like to see someone else's hair in the bathtub and on the bathroom floor and I don't like to see debris in the corners of the room and under the bed. Clearning service needs some guidance. Other than that the stay was fine. But Hampton Inns are better value.
review.negativeRemarks: Better cleaning

review.title: Great and convenient
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay being close to the airport and close to the city. The room was clean and comfortable. The view was of a produce company building and they were running trucks and forklifts until pretty late at night and that was noisy but overall it was a pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and the bed was comfy
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom in my room and the one down in the lobby were not very clean. Our tub and floor had hair in them and the floor needed to be vacuumed.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport and just a short drive to pier 39 where we had dinner.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and staff good location for traveller
The staff was friendly. Bed was comfortable. There was a lot of hair on the bathroom floor.

review.title: Well priced hotel near to airport
review.reviewText:
Easy to find from airport. Hotel is bright & clean, staff were helpful.
Rooms were of a good size, we had 2 double beds per room.
No problem parking.
Breakfast ok, however we did not like the single-use crockery & cutlery, nor can this be environmentally good (bag loads of rubbish after every meal).
There's a small outdoor pool (heated) & a little gym.
No restaurant or bar but there is a Denny's burger/ omelette/ fries type restaurant on the same site (not gourmet but quick & easy).
SITE: there are two buildings - main building & an annex. We got put in the annex. If I went there again I'd stipulate the main building because: annex is a few minutes walk across a disused railway line; breakfast is in main building. More to the point, annex is much closer to a busy & noisy railway line (fast trains through the night) & there's also a big 'produce' warehouse you have to walk past. Not a particular hazard if you stick to your side of the road but there are huge trucks, fork lifts vans operating.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was reasonable, rooms were comfortable & of good size.
review.negativeRemarks: There did tend to be cleaners with bit rubbish bags & carts everywhere - in the corridors as well as around breakfast table
review.locationRemarks:
Industrial area so not pictureque. About 30 mins into SF (but rush hour much slower) 
Not much within walking distance (Safeways 10 mins away)

review.title: Golf bit noise
review.reviewText: Good hotel bit very noise between 11 pm to 5 am be cause the hotel is clase to Raúl train road

review.title: Sleeping next to US 101
review.reviewText:
This is a clean and well staffed motel which is, unfortunately, immediately adjacent to a major California freeway. 
The rooms are clean and spacious but even with ear plugs the road noise is loud. 
The breakfast is acceptable but there's less choice than at competitors such as the Holiday Inn. The only warm food selection is waffles. The eggs are hard boiled but cold. Juice and coffee are available.

review.title: Affordable pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText: It was a pleasant hotel experience, near the airport but the sound was not an issue. I was happy with the quality for the price. Probably one of the most affordable rooms I could find in the area without having to sacrifice comfort and cleanliness as well as safety/security.
review.negativeRemarks: The only issue I had was that there were no refrigerators in the rooms, which of course meant not being able to have food on hand for my children.
review.locationRemarks: We visited both the SF Zoo and Aquarium on the bay, which were both relatively close to our hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel near San Francisco City
review.reviewText: good experience, we will return.Its a nice please, the room good and people is frendly
review.locationRemarks: near shopping, san francisco city, dennys, and others

review.title: Nice hotel close to San francisco
review.reviewText: Had great time and the staff is very kind, we were late for breakfast but still the staff helped us get our breakfast. The staff have Very professional interaction with the guests

review.title: Hotel very well located from the airport.
review.reviewText: Hotel very well located from the airport. Also not very far from downtown (about 12 - 14 miles).

review.title: This hotel was not very clean at all.
review.reviewText: I will not recommend this hotel.  It was not clean, the floor in our room was sticky.
The bathroom and carpet were disgusting. They never came to clean the room or exchange out towels. Will never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: customer service and cleanliness

review.title: Hotel stay at La Quinta N. San Francisco airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel looked like it had been through a war. It was old, only one light worked in the entire room.

The air conditioner was extremely noisy, and cycled on and off all night keeping us awake.

They had no blankets - only very heavy quilts so you either froze (without the quilt) or were so hot you couldn't sleep.

Only one elevator which was extremely slow. There were some broken tiles in the bathroom which they did not replace, but patched with grout.
review.positiveRemarks: It was fairly close to the airport and they had a shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Loud with children running around but could happen at any locations. Other than that it was not bad.

review.title: Pleasent hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but ask for a hotel room not facing the freeway. The odd room numbers not the even.

review.title: I hope that you the smell of cigarette smell.
review.reviewText: Room 434 smelled badly of used cigarette smoke.  Staff left opened window to reduce smell, but it didn't work!  Open window had no screen and faced active train tracks.  Front desk attempted to rationalize room condition and would not relocate us; nor did they ever show up, as promised, with air deodorant.  I'll never go there again.  Stay at own risk for $175 per night

review.title: carpet is old and dirty
review.reviewText: okay, beds are small for two people, AC is not that cold

review.title: Convenient and Inexpensive
review.reviewText: We booked two rooms. One room didn't have A/C. The other room was on the 3rd floor, below the smoking floor, and had a strong smell of cigarette smoke - probably from the vent (?). We ran max A/C in that room and kept the smell to a minimum. A basic breakfast is provided in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Non-smoking rooms on the 3rd floor smell strongly of smoke. (The smoking floor is directly above).
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to SFO and major highways. There is an inexpensive restaurant across the parking lot.

review.title: Great room, Friendly staff
review.reviewText: This was a really great stay.  The room was very nice and big.  The bath was also very nice.  However, parking was not good at all.  We had to circle the lot to find a place to park and two of the nights the only place available was next to a fence that we weren't sure if it was legal for parking.  Also, the breakfast was not good at all.  If you like toast and cereal it was fine but most places we stay where we pay this much we at least get a nice breakfast which includes a hot egg and meat dish.  ie Sausage, gravy, etc
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and add a hot breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Short trip to San Francisco.

review.title: I expected much more of a LA Quinta.
review.reviewText: La Quinta is usually very nice, this was sad, nothing good about our room.  Right next to the train tracks, quite loud. Will not stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: A good restaurant on Grand, actually not a good place to Stay,  we have another night on the 27th, not looking foreword to it!

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Awesome place, easy to find and comfy, definitely will recommend

review.title: Short stay, nice hotel close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Service was pleasant.  Room was clean.  Beds were not comfortable, but at least they were better than the floor.  Shower was ok, shower head was low, and water pressure was a little below average, but at least it was clean. Towers were clean but small and there weren't enough in the room for 3 people, well we asked for more - but they never showed up.  We had to pick them up, but at least we can get more.  Breakfast was good, go early, large area to eat but of course not large enough for the number of guests when everyone wants to eat right before closing, I think it was like 9 AM, too early for vacation schedule.  Overall my stay was ok.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: It was a very good stay at La Quinta. The hotel is nicely placed. Its not very far from the city and is close to the airport. A definite plus is that it has free parking. :) Breakfast was good and so was our room. It was spacious and clean. What more can you ask? I have stayed in La Quinta Chicago and the experience was similar.
review.negativeRemarks: A weighing machine for weighing bags would be great :)

review.title: Comfortable for multiple nights
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely friendly, from the front desk ladies to the cleaning staff.  The breakfast was good but can become a bit packed as the morning wears on.  Best to come early to avoid the waffle line.
review.locationRemarks: Be prepared to make a turn into the lot at the Dennys.  Coming up Airport, it is a sudden turn.

review.title: Hotel on a budget
review.reviewText: Our group stayed there for 4 nights in August 2014. Clean room,  helpful and friendly staff. The drive to SF downtown and other local attractions was OK.  There is a convenient  shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Cool for a short stay
review.reviewText: This was cool for a short stay. You will need a taxi to go explore if you want to venture and see the real sanfrancisco. It's located in an industrial , not a vacation spot . Staff was extremely nice and helpful. It was cool

review.title: worried it would be Motel funky but was GREAT!
review.reviewText:
loved the bathroom! way big
the rooms in san francisco tend to run small and this was just south of the main city and was roomy and cozy and comfortable - just like home!

Pleasantly surprised. Staff very accommodating. Room upstairs and very quiet with very comfortable king bed.
Far better than expected.

review.title: Felt like a castaway!
review.reviewText: This was probably my worst hotel experience. We were exhausted having been flying all day. We checked in at almost 11:30 pm  they sent us to another building which we had to hike to dragging our bags across railroad tracks and through parking lot and to the 3rd floors (elevator thank heavens but far from entrance).  I'm not exaggerating.  In the morning we asked for the shuttle to be there at 6:30 am so we could get to the airport in time.  The desk clerk  said it would be waiting for us right at the entrance of the back building we were in.  You guessed it, right?  No shuttle ... After 10 minutes we had to schlep our bags again over the railroad tracks and through the parking lot to the main hotel building and the shuttle finally showed up there.  These people don't care about weary travelers.  Their customer service sucks.  Do you really have to ban people to the outback?  How about taking people in a golf cart instead of treating them like pack mules?  Room was okay, but not going there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was fine but canceled out by the hike and the shuttle being at the wrong place.  That clerk did not care.  She knew the shuttle routine.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk personnel and golf cart service for back building castaways.
review.locationRemarks: I used to live in SSF.

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown
review.reviewText: Everything was great at this hotel. I liked it. Breakfast was good but maybe there needs more tables because the hotel is big and crowded.
