Room smelled like cleaning supplies (clorox) and i had children with me. Did not expect the facility to be this way after all the cost was not cheap either.

review.title: Not that good.
review.reviewText:
The north-side building of the inn is close to Caltrain railroad, which bothers you with a big noise all the time. Also, that building is far from the main building which provides a breakfast. You need to walk to get your breakfast every morning. 

It is cheap compared to downtown hotels but the area around the inn doesn't look safe at all. 

The shuttle from/ to the SFO airport runs every 30 minutes, which means you need to wait a lot to use it. I saw many other shuttles coming and picking up travelers every 5 or 10 minutes. 

I don't recommend this La Quinta inn compared to other inns around the SFO airport area unless the price is a lot cheaper than other inns.

review.title: Do not book, dirty, staff is rude
review.reviewText: Horrible experience! The tub got clogged after my husband showered! Tried calling the front desk through the room's phone and it did not work. After getting a hold of the front desk, and told them about the issue, they sent someone who took about 40 minutes to fix the clogged tub and phone issue. So much for feeling super tired and just wanting to rest! In addition to all this drama the staff is not professional at all. They need definite training in customer relations! The hotel is dirty too, and breakfast is mostly carbs. I have booked at other 3 star hotels and while they were definitely not a five star hotel, they were clean for the most part and staff was friendly, welcoming, and respectful. My family and I did not experience this at La Quinta in San Francisco (by the airport).

review.title: Nice staff, hotel needs repairs
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great! The pool was out for 4 of the days we were there but they worked with us on that. 1 room we had the AC was broken but they worked on fixing it quickly and let us change rooms. The other room we had a bathtub that seemed to be possibly busted. The bath mats are glued down so we couldn't see what was going on underneath it but it cracked and shifted on the bottom. The beds were not queens, they were doubles but comfortable and the breakfast was decent. The hotel seemed reasonably clean. It is a noisy area, didn't bother me but light sleepers may have problems.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was kind and easy to work with. Fairly clean, and decent breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Repairs to rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Grand Ave has a bunch of restaurants but kind of questionable side of town. Close to City and Airport.

review.reviewText: Old old facilities that caused water leakage. Breakfast is a so-so. The attitude of staff made the whole situation better. Over-priced for this quality.

review.title: Very friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel shuttle van was a good way to hook up to BART at the airport and then take it to the city. They took our luggage behind the counter at 10:00 am and we picked it up at 4:30 pm for a fast trip to the airport to make our plane. We had 15 minutes to eat breakfast, but because it was a busy morning, it was extended to another 30 minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Short shuttle trip to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator is pretty slow. Some of the decor is worn from time and use, but still kept clean.
review.locationRemarks: We spent most of our time in city center. Went to a baseball game at AT & T stadium. The BART was a 10 minute walk away from the stadium.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Bathroom could have been cleaner.  Otherwise, I would stay at again

review.title: good access to BART
review.reviewText: The pictures of this hotel do not tell the story.  It is actually a main hotel with a second section that is across an old railroad track, and if you are staying in the second section, you have to walk a ways to get to any of the amenities -- pool, gym, breakfast, office, etc.  Also it is next door to a factory or something that smells like garbage.  The room was ok, but for the price I have seen better.  We wanted to experience the BART, and this hotel was great for that.  It has a shuttle that takes you to the BART station at the airport.  That part worked so nicely.   The shuttle drivers were always friendly and on time.  The hotel staff was very nice and even printed maps and driving directions for us when we needed that.   So, plus for staff and BART access and minus for room and functionality and surrounding area equals ok on the whole.

review.title: Upgraded to suite
review.reviewText: Just a 1 night stay pre flight......great staff who upgraded us to a suite which was a very pleasant surprise.......location somewhat noisy due to trains/planes and automobiles in close proximity
review.locationRemarks: close to SFO airport with efficient shuttle

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Stay was okay we asked for non-smoking room but when we got keys we landed on smokers floor & smokers room. new assigned room :) Only one ice machine working in the entire hotel  floor so that wasn't fun. Restroom had sprinkler water leak. Breakfast was fair, enough for everyone. Although little issues when we brought it up to front desk the were very concern & apologized. At end of check out they even credited us one free night.  No place is perfect, & your not even in your room but only to sleep San Francisco is beautiful so no not a bad place the staff was friendly & the cleaning maid did a great job.

review.title: Clean hotel close to Airport
review.reviewText: I went there knowing I was only going to be staying one night.  Shuttle from the airport was convenient.  There is a Hertz within walking distance and a Denny's shares the parking lot.  Not a whole lot to do in the immediate area.  Industrial area and located near the highway.  Overall I was pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel the staff and the complimentary breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and they offered a nice choice for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Location wasn't very nice, there was

review.title: La Quinta is 5-stars!
review.reviewText: Excellent value and service! Great airport shuttle service. Spacious and clean rooms!

review.title: Overall very nice
review.reviewText: Only problem was the operation of the electronic locks.   Room was clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: locks

review.reviewText: We only spent one night and left very early.  Coffee station for those catching early flights would be nice. ( ie 5am onwards).  Hotel was clean, quiet, and very convenient for airport access.
Had a hotel employee walk in unannounced about 7:30 p.m.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: This is the fifth time in the last eight years that I have stayed at that hotel. I have always found the the staff to be friendly and very helpful. The grounds are always kept up and the rooms are very comfortable. The parking is sometimes crowded but I can live with that.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close to the city and right off the hwy 101.

review.title: SF low price
review.reviewText: The room had new carpet not all vacuumed w hair in bathroom and dirty sink faucet. We called front desk they couldn't give us a different room but had maintenance clean floor.

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to the Cow Palace
review.reviewText: Enjoyable experience would stay there again.  The rooms were clean.
review.positiveRemarks: My family enjoyed the breakfast - the waffle's were a hit!
review.negativeRemarks: Only thing is wish we were closer to pool, but next time I can request that.  Our room was way in the back past the railroads.
review.locationRemarks: There is a shopping center about 7 miles away along with a movie theater.  There is also a sushi dining and convenient fast food place within a mile.

review.reviewText: Highly recommend it for its advertised price. Free continental breakfast: waffles, boiled eggs, toast, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt. Pool. Clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: they advertise queen-sized beds but they are  actually full-sized
review.locationRemarks: Denny's at walking distance. 25 minute drive to Fisherman's wharf

review.reviewText: Our room didn't have towels and two windows were up.  One was warped and wouldn't go all the way down.  Hallway smelled like smoke.
review.negativeRemarks: Room stocked

review.title: Great friendly staff,nice breakfast, clean rooms.
review.reviewText: It served the purpose, the rooms were clean and comfortable and certainly having a breakfast buffet was a nice addition .
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if the bathroom (sink) had a separate door .
review.locationRemarks: Not a very attractive location

review.title: DISSAPOINTING!
review.reviewText: When I booked my reservation, the hotel looked nice.  My first disappointment was the location, a big OLD warehouse, right next to a train track, train runs every day.  In front of the warehouse was a big pile of rubble, old wood, scrap stuff, not pleasant at all.  The furniture at the entrance looks very old and raggedy, carpet old and dirty in some areas.  The bathroom could have used a bit of repair on the floor and a "good" coat of paint to hide some dirt high on the wall/ceiling.  My mom  who is 93 had spilled some crumbs on the floor the night before, we left the room hoping they clean it up, came back beds were made, but the crumbs were still there on the floor.  I had to ask the front desk to please have them vacuum our room.  They vacuumed the next day, unplugged the refrigerator where I had my insulin, I did not realized this until 2 days later.  The towels they provide were very thin, you dry your arms and it's all soaked..  From my room (4th floor) I could look down directly at the pool, which looked so dirty, the pool area did not look inviting at all...
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable and clean, the furniture was also very nice.  They had FREE WiFi in the lobby and in the rooms & FREE breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The interior appearance of the hotel could be more peasant, I heard that they had just remodeled, but I did not see anything inside indicating that.
review.locationRemarks: Not much, mainly industrial area, only Denny's within walking distance.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Next to train tracks and produce warehouse. Loud and old. Toilet ran.

review.title: Hotel stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Called Expedite for a reservation to stay at the airport.  They said, they had the La Quinta Inn San Francisco Airport for $145.00 with taxes would be $165.00.  This would include a shuttle to the airport, parking the car for 7 days and also breakfast.  What a deal.  Arrived at La Quinta showed the reservation they said this is for the room only.  It will cost you $30.00 dollars a day to park your car.  We will need to cancel your reservation with Expedite.  We will sell you the package here for $230.00 dollars.  They call Expedite and told them they did not accept the reservation for all 3 things.  If I need this, I could go to Park Fly.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Clean room
review.reviewText: My experience was overall good, I was a  disappointed with the swimming pool and jacuzzi because they were really dirty and we could not go swimming.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean.  Close to freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep the swimming pool and jacuzzi clean, no matter what type of weather you are having.
review.locationRemarks: the location was great.

review.title: Close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Close to Car rental center, gasoline station and Denny's.

review.title: Close to the airport and The City
review.reviewText: Picked up a friend at SFO, he was able to ride the shuttle, and meet at the hotel, great bed, quiet, nice room, Denny's in the parking lot for breakfast, then in to The City in the AM

review.title: Best breakfast
review.reviewText: Breakfast was excellent , so many varieties and tasty food, only the breakfast hours is short till 9am , it would be best if it was till 10am.

review.title: Hotel allows pets and close to freeway
review.reviewText:
Room was surprisingly quiet given location near airport, and sandwiched between the freeway and CalTrain rail. Biggest problem was cigarette smoke coming from under door of adjoining room. I thought maybe it was a smoking room as they didn't have any "no smoking" signs in room. I should have called the front desk to ask (but thought it was a smoking area since I'd forgotten to specify no smoking room) and later learned smoking was only allowed on top floor (I was on the 1st). Would have had a more comfortable experience without the smoke and hope the neighbor was charged for smoking in room.

Place was good for my dog and had space to walk him around and plenty of grass. The poop bag dispenser was empty the entire 4 nights I was there, and though I had my own bags, others clearly didn't and poop was left in numerous places on the grass. Hotel staff picked it up over time, but supplied bags in the dispenser might have helped it stay cleaner.

Continental breakfast was fair, but to get to it I had to leave my building, cross over the unused railroad tracks, and then walk past most of neighboring building to get to breakfast room. Wasn't very conducive to having breakfast with having to put my dog into my car or leave in my room. They also ran out of cream for coffee for breakfast and had no more available to replace.

Would be ok without the smoking or if you don't have pet or are in first bldg (with breakfast room) if you do have pet.
review.positiveRemarks: Rate was good for area; pets were allowed; bathroom was spacious (had wheelchair accessible room); access to freeway was easy and parking sufficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Add "no smoking" notices in room (other hotels frequently have paper card notices). I'd have called office if I'd known neighbor should not smoke.
review.locationRemarks: Location was convenient to freeway access.

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText: We used this hotel for overnight to travel back home because it was close to the airport. There was a free shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Better shuttle service when we dropped off car at rental location at SFO. We had to call after an hour of waiting. They paid for a cab back.

review.title: Not kid friendly. Only ok for last minute crash.
review.reviewText: The keys with the work, the hallway so funny. The room was a decent size for two double beds but the debts were very small especially if you're a tall person that six-foot. Tell was definitely discussing as there was mold where the soap dish was also the picture for the water was horrible and the bathroom itself was just disgusting. The hotel was literally located next to a produce warehouse so it was all the way through in the back and just very ugly and disgusting.

review.title: Bad Value and Unpleasant Room
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel based on some of the reviews and descriptions provided. We were expecting a shuttle at the airport and none arrived. We arrived at the hotel by cab and were given our room keys and were told that someone would walk us there, as it was not in the main building and required some walking in the dark. That too did not happen. The room was hot and did not look very appealing. We were glad to leave in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: did not stay long enough to know

review.title: Hotel close to the Airport
review.reviewText:
It is a great deal. Is close to the Airport but also to stores, groceries and fast to go in and out of San Francisco.
Staff was very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast was also great.
review.negativeRemarks: Make it a compleate non smoking hotel
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, Groceries, restaurants (it is possible to have dinner at Dennys across the street

review.title: nice hotel but definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: our room was nice and big very comfortable the continental breakfast was very good everything was clean and perfectthe shuttle service was very convenient close to the BART station
review.negativeRemarks: They need a store near by
review.locationRemarks: Having a Dennys in the parking lot was very convenient

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Nice front desk help. Had a bit if trouble printing boarding passes so they allowed us to use their office computer.

review.title: Convenient but.....
review.reviewText:
There was mold in the bathroom,
A sketchy loading dock is almost on top of the building and if you are not in the main building you have to cross train tracks to et to your room. Walls were so paper thin I woke up in the middle of the night from someone in another room snoring. Pay the extra money and go to another hotel.

review.title: Birthday tour of Pacific Coast
review.reviewText:
Long weekend for a birthday tour of the Bay Area and the Pacific Coast and was looking for a hotel near to the airport for a flawless stay with transport over to SFO at 4 a.m. on our departure day for 6 a.m. flight. Upon arrival in town, I stopped by this hotel several days before actual rental date to see if everything fit my needs on actual date of reservation. It seemed nice and comfortable.
On day of arrival, the shuttle schedule was nicely explained to us and that at 4 am shuttle would have us at airport at 4:20, and the driver showed up and delivered us at that time along with a dozen others at 4 am.
review.positiveRemarks: The grounds were taken very good care of, the room was very comfortable, bath very nice and I really enjoyed my stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The morning schedule of very early departures has NO access to any food in the breakfast area, the coffee was NOT good, FOOD of needs to be available.
review.locationRemarks: The only restaurant was DENNY's located in front of the hotel, I like DENNY's but there were no other very near by eateries

review.title: OK Large Room Smoke Odor
review.reviewText: Large Room, King Bed. Room Smelled of Smoking. Overheard Staff saying that Internet (Expedia) customers for less than 2 nights relegated to smoking rooms. No ability to print boarding passes or office environment. Not very acceptable for an airport location.
review.negativeRemarks: Recognize that the management attitude is not acceptable for the smoke rooms and lack of office environment is not acceptable to business travelers.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: I found this hotel at a very reasonable price at expedia.com. I found no negatives. I had a very early flight and the desk clerk offered to open the dining area so I could get some yogurt for breakfast. Very nice.

review.title: Nice, clean hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for two nights. Room was clean; washroom needs an upgrade but it was clean nonetheless. Hotel slightly exceeded my expectations because of the quality of breakfast. Probably the best breakfast I've had at a motel. Waffles were great without being exceptional. Hotel was far from the main San Francisco city, but I didn't mind the daily drive in to the city. Location was convenient to me. You get what you pay for...
review.negativeRemarks: Washrooms may need an upgrade
review.locationRemarks: There were some shops nearby, probably walking distance.

review.title: Great staff and good location
review.reviewText: We stayed for almost a week here during a family emergency in San Fran. The staff was great and responded to our request for some extras we had planed for but were not included in our quoted rate. The housekeeping staff was also excellent. We will be happy to stay here in the future.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants near buy.

review.title: dog friendly place closed to the airport
review.reviewText: this is not a luxury hotel, but a friendly place to spend a night close to the airport

review.title: Long walk from desk to room in second building
review.reviewText: I guess you get what you pay for.... Inadequate parking, bare-bones room, dirty walls in common areas and the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Denny's in parking lot was very convenient
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING else

review.title: Bad service, Hotel's facility not same as advert.
review.reviewText: No reffrigerator, no microwave and shuttle bus to town as same as the advertisment.

review.title: Never will stay here again.
review.reviewText: There was several people partying at the pool who were extremely loud. They drank several cases of beer, 2 fifths of whiskey, and purchased drugs. Complaints to staff were ignored. Manager stated he told them to be quiet...which he never did. Manager had no regard for his visitors, and refused to do anything about it. Just gave us a bunch of lip service. Room smelled like cigarettes. Carpets in hallways and lobby were filthy. Towels were very rough and dingy. Overall, our experience was unsatisfactory and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in SF.

review.title: Comfortable stay, free amenities Worth it.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean enough. We didn't spend much time there but it was perfect for what we wanted. The free parking, breakfast, wifi, airport shuttle, and its surprising proximity to the entire city was exactly what we needed. All the extras make the stay worth it.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. We booked for the pool and it was looked at first. When it opened it was dirty. Hotel is next to a vegetable plant. Police was present for whatever reason. The water did not drain fast enough when we showered in the AM, 4 of us that was discussing.

review.title: Terrible staffs
review.reviewText:
Once we stepped in, the two ladies at the front desk did not even look at us and did not say hi as well.
They were chatting with each other instead of greeting us!!!!
Our room did not have a smoke detector so I asked the front desk to send us somebody and check it.
The maintenance guy was so rude and he was shouting at us that it doesn't matter that we don't have a fire detector.
By Expedia, I booked a non smoking room because I have 2 kids but the front desk ladies gave me a smoking room. One of the front desk ladies said that Expedia wasn't guaranteed, but all the other hotels we booked did what we asked for. We have been traveling 3 weeks and went to a different hotel each day. La Quintas was the worst hotel we rented. WOW.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: Hotel itself was very nice. Staff was great and the shuttle to the airport was excellent. We had the back building which was inconvenient in dragging suitcases across the parking lot and railroad tracks to get to the entrance for the shuttle Other than that it was very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and staff were great and the breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Accessibility to the back building could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Airport and restaurants

review.title: Worst Hotel I've ever stepped foot in.
review.reviewText: Hallways smelled like Marijuana. Room smelled like cigarettes. AC unit quit working in the middle of the night. Hotel sit next to a railroad track that is very busy and loud. Hardly slept a minute. Paid 4 star price for a 1 star experience.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The experience was good. Check in/out was easy and quick. The property was next to the railroad tracks, but don't let that deter you. There was also a produce factory next to the property. Again, don't let that deter you. The room was cleaned for us everyday and they were quite comfortable. Unfortunately, the Wi-fi was not working for half our stay (2 nights). But I called it in, and they were able to fix it for the rest of our stay. They serve light breakfast (ex. bagels, waffles, cereal etc.) I read the reviews before booking this hotel and my experience seems to be in line with the other reviews. The hotel is a reasonable distance from San Francisco attractions (about 20 min to SF). Lastly, parking is free, but it was be somewhat challenging if you arrive past 9PM as it gets full. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I would recommend to anyone on a budget. If you just need a place to sleep, this hotel will do everything just fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, Free parking, Free wi-fi, free breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Short drives to San Francisco attractions.

review.title: Smells smoke in non-smoking room
review.reviewText: The room smells smoke, the man at front desk refused to Change room for us. The room has flies in it, you have to kill them yourself. Smells like trash can outside of the building. I woke up in the middle of the night to turn on the fan. Because the smoke smells even stronger on pillow and comforter( the smoke was light under fresh air spray in the beginning, and getting stronger after the air spray smells fade away). Horrible experience.

review.title: Close to Airport with free shuttle
review.reviewText: Last minute booking, very accommodating. Clean, safe area and comfy beds.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle bus to and from airport
review.negativeRemarks: light seeping though the curtain during the night
review.locationRemarks: there is a Deny's Diner across the carpark if you miss breakfast.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: I had a good experience, clean, not very private though. It was close to the airport and to the downtown area.
review.negativeRemarks: would improve the parking.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: I was surprised with the enthusiasm of the staff. It was very low.... maybe end of shift. The romm was great, including the washroom facility. I liked that the tv was simple to operate... no manuals required :-)

review.title: Airport hotel that is definitely not non-smoking
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in a 2 queen bed room with our two young children. When we arrived we discovered that our non-smoking room, which is a must as our daughter has asthma, was overwhelming with the smell of cigarette smoke. When we complained at reception we were told there was nothing they could do as this was only a request and because WE HAD BOOKED ON EXPEDIA! After explaining about the asthma we were offered a bottle of air freshener. We spent an uncomfortable night in the room and woke up smelling of cigarette smoke. I raised my concerns again in the morning where I got an apology and an explanation that it was a non-smoking room but the rooms either side were smoking rooms. I would definitely not go there again or recommend staying there.

review.title: Good for one night
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The room was not as clean as I would have liked but it was comfortable. Maybe a little over priced but I was pleased!

review.title: Noisy room
review.reviewText: This is my second time staying here. This second one was disappointing because the room I got is close to the Freeway. I could here the car and truck noises. I had a difficulty getting the sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: They need insulate the room that is close to the freeway
review.locationRemarks: Location is good because it is close to downtown.

review.title: Good value for the money you pay!
review.reviewText: Close to airport and Highway 101. Small rooms but kept very clean and the cleaning staff did a good job. Right on the rail tracks and might be inconvenient for those who are bothered by trains going at night but we slept well. What we did not know was that the hotels rooms were split in to 2 blocks. The blocks were separated by the rail track. Kind of inconvenient if the weather is bad but not bad since the walk is for only a few yards. Outdoor pool was clean. Breakfast is reasonable but not many varieties - bagels, toast, coffee, boiled eggs, yogurt, waffles and fruit. Coffee and juice also available. Staff was courteous to allow us use the breakfast room for coffee during off hours and use the microwave.
review.positiveRemarks: They run a shuttle to airport every 1/2 hour which is great. You can catch the shuttle to airport and then ride to downtown San Fran or anywhere else
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could have been better. Extend breakfast hours - currently closes at 9:00 AM weekdays.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Fran downtown. You can drive if you want to but parking in downtown is expensive - $30/day. Walk to Dennys, Starbucks, KFC, etc.

review.title: Good hotel to stay in at reasonable price
review.reviewText: All the places we visited in San Francisco were at short driving distances from the hotel. We enjoyed our stay. The telephone in the room was not working though.

review.title: close to nearby airports, great location.
review.reviewText: I'd stay here again if it's for a quick work trip... not sure if I'd bring my family here as it's not as "nice".

review.title: comfortable, quiet
review.reviewText: comfortable, quiet. good service, good breakfast, clean.

review.title: a weekend away
review.reviewText: When booking hotels i like to go stay with ones im familiar with and know what they have too offer. Ive satyed in La quintas before, so I looked over the photos and reviews and there were more pros than cons so i booked. We got there around 6pm roon was ready and clean. Bathrooms were nice and tidy. The employees were helpful , the werent overly friendly but working another day, did what we asked and helped us with what we needed help with. Breakfast was a joy. Staying on the south side was better than in they city. Its just amazig how it would take an hour to get somewhere relativly close and wow to absolutely no parking ANYWHERE. But if you want to enjoy the main cites hotel is just a drive away. I usually sleep ok when comes to hotel matresses but i slept surprisingly very good here. Overal stay was very pleasant and i would recommend defiantly.

review.title: Close to airport and expressway
review.reviewText: This hotel was in good location, but very close to the expressway, the traffic noise at night was sometimes to much, but if you are looking for an overnight stay close to SF airport this is a good reasonably priced hotel to stay. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great. The lobby area and the rooms were always clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade windows to create sound proofing in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Small strip located not from the hotel, a short walk, a Denny's on property. The 101 express way was easy to get on to and off of.

review.title: nice hotel close to the SFO airport
review.reviewText: Room was quiet, clean and comfortable, bathroom was clean and shower was satisfactorily hot. Breakfast was good. Staff was considerate. Shuttle to and from airport was on time and convenient at 1/2 hour intervals. Very satisfied.

review.title: Hotel close to Airport
review.reviewText: We were grateful we were given a room on the 1st floor. Breakfast was good, had variety of food. Downtown San Francisco was only a short drive away. Easy access to Airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Had a pool and a hot tub. Computer with free internet access. TV in lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk/Staff could be friendlier. Door or curtain between bathroom sink and beds. No information taken about our rental car.
review.locationRemarks: There was restaurants - beach - mountains - scenic drive

review.title: Nice, clean and quiet room.
review.reviewText: Very nice and very close to downtown restaurants.

review.title: airport delay
review.reviewText: Our flight was cancelled and we needed a room for one night close to the airport. The airport shuttle was timely and efficient. Hotel check in was prompt and courteous and they gave us a late check out of 1. The room was clean but a little worn. Bathroom was clean and could use nicer towels. Overall, everything was ok. Nothing outstanding, but for 100 a night it served its purpose. We didn't get up for breakfast from 6-9. Too early. There is a Denny's right next door.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very friendly, Jacuzzi looked nice but didn't get to use.
review.negativeRemarks: Update carpeting and new towels.
review.locationRemarks: About 5 minutes from airport. Taxi to downtown about 35 depending on traffic.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Clean, cozy, comfortable and valueable! A great deal for the price. Beautiful surroundings, clean and easy accessible to freeways and restaurants.

review.title: Hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at the la Quinta in Berkeley, so chose La Quinta near the airport to ease my departure. What a difference. It was right next to the freeway so incredibly noisy all night. Sticky door meant key did not work. Small, cramped room. No amenities. Wet spots on the carpet. Would never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing. Clean carpets. Check doors and keys to be sure they work. Rearrange furniture so there is room to move in the room. More channels on TV
review.locationRemarks: Airport. Can't imagine anyone would stay here if they did not need to catch an early flight.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: Bad castumer serves.i don't like the room in side

review.title: Separate building
review.reviewText:
We were put in a separate building way back from the main Hotel, behind some railroad tracks, close to the Freeway, and yes, at one point during the night we woke up very confused about the loud noise from a passing truck. I had to walk in the dark, across railroad tracks behind the buildings in the poorly light area near a factory to use the computer to print off our boarding passes the next day. No, with the cramped conditions, I will probably not use La Quinta Inns again.
The staff was very nice. They should receive many compliments on how they handle things. I was sitting at the computer listening to a difficult situation and she was very credible and a tribute to La Quinta. Unfortunately, that back area is just not where we ever want to stay again. As we fly into San Francisco at least once a year, I just have to say I will not stay there again. Sorry
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk assistants were very pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: If you must put people in that back area, even on Expedia, you must tell them as most people will stay at a different location, in my opinion.

review.title: Hotel staff unwilling to assist
review.reviewText: Booked a non-smoking room with a king bed and when checking in was given a smoking room. The desk clerk did not state it was a smoking room and when we walked into the room, the smell was horrible. Called the clerk but was told it was the last room avail and she couldn't do anything for us. We asked to speak to a manager and all of a sudden, a non-smoking room with double beds became avail. Breakfast was ok and there is no bar to get a cocktail. Will not stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport

review.title: location of our room
review.reviewText: We were stuck in a building way back behind the regular hotel in a group of rooms across rail road tracks about 1/2 block from the mail hotel. This was even closer to the highway and we were awakened twice during the night with truck noises. I needed to access the airlines and print out our boarding passes, so had to walk to the main hotel and back. There was minimal lighting but it was rather frightening. I will not stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk personnel were very helpful and nice

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport. We stayed at it one night at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end of our trip. The first night we were placed in a room that had an extreme smoke smell. When we went back at the end of our trip, we were given a room in the building at the back of the hotel. It turned out it backed up against railroad tracks. Every 15 minutes to 30 minutes a train went by. It also turned out that the hotel was right by a produce warehouse. When we looked out our window, we had a view of a huge tractor trailer container full of bad produce. Would not recommend staying at this hotel.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText:
we stayed for 2 days and nights. the beds are comfortable. The sheets are very clean. Everything we needed was provided. The room was quiet enough for sleeping.
Plenty of outlets, free internet etc.
The carpet seemed like it needed shampooing was the only thing that bothered me.
otherwise we had a nice comfortable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the carpets,
review.locationRemarks: Close to the SF airport and Cow Palace

review.title: Close to SFO, peculiar place
review.reviewText: Stayed in the back building by the CalTrans line and the 101. A little loud. Somewhat clean room. Odd that you drive next to produce plant to go to your room. There has to be an interesting zoning story here somewhere
review.positiveRemarks: Relatively clean after the first night. When I checked in cleaning staff forgot to pick up used towels and trash in the bathroom floor. OK though
review.negativeRemarks: I think it is a good as it gets. Weird location, but OK
review.locationRemarks: Denny's is next door

review.title: Good for the price.
review.reviewText: Nice stay. Wonderful staff.
hotel was in good condition, staff were friendly but hotel was right next to freeway, very noisy, constant road noise so didn't get a lot of sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: had a restaurant right next door, plus shuttle to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: double glassing to reduce road noise

review.title: Hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Great beds, near SFO airport, shuttle to airport was on time. Breakfast was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful beds and the pickup to the airport was on time.

review.title: Cconvenient and comfy
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the nice beds and quality sheets. The location is great. There's a sweet little downtown with all the conveniences so you don't have to go to the city and park. Very nice deco decor and tired charm. Love that they take dogs!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the SFO Int airport
review.reviewText: Room clean and confourtable, good breakfast, good wifi speeed

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Staff was great, friendly and helpful. Hotel wad very clean and room was very comfortable.

review.title: Handy hotel to SFO and easy access and parking.
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable stay near SFO and has good shuttle service. Also rooms are large with excellent bathroom facility

I found out that Expedia was not the least expensive option - could have used AAA and saved $10 - so next time will not use Expedia
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia could give better rates than others!

review.title: Football Game
review.reviewText:
The room as comfortable, clean and convenient to Candlestick. The front desk was very helpfull in getting us taxi service to the game on 12/23 so we did not need to drive. Breakfast in the morning was perfect and a very nice stay.

Thank you.

review.title: Location, close to airport and S.F.
review.reviewText: Staff was great, room was comfortable, would go back and stay there.

review.title: The employees
review.reviewText:
They were helpful and informational about the surrounding area. To me that is very important when you from out of town. I appreciate them and give them a 10 rating

Thanks

review.title: Adequate for one night stay.
review.reviewText: Older motel, nice breakfast, good location.
Staff were great, room could use some updating as tub and sink were well worn, tub shifted as you changed standing position, and I am a small and before average weight person.
review.positiveRemarks: Pet friendly, no extra charge, parking included
review.negativeRemarks: Fixtures
review.locationRemarks: Location great for access SFO and surprisingly a nice main street to South San Francisco.

review.title: Fall stay @ LaQuinta
review.reviewText:
I've asked for handicapped rooms, never got one. They offered me one this time around, but they're all on the first floor. Well, I have to keep windows open for fresh air, I cant tolerate fans. And the windows are locked on the first floor. Not good. Requested microwave & fridge - very handy.
So we've stayed on both the 2nd & 3rd floors. Fair. Some nasty spots of mold though - clean it up LaQuinta!!! Not healthy. Then there's the outdoor malodorous, nearly obnoxious smells. Is it the big building next door?
Dog run area - hey folks, pick up the dog poop. We bring our dogs, we pick up the poop. Even in all my chronic pain and limited mobility, I slowly bend over and adjust my stance, to pick it up. Come on people.
Front desk staff not very friendly or welcoming. ONLY 1 person has ever been kind, listened politely and smiled genuinely - Regina. Thank you Regina!! Customer service needs improvement. A smile & welcome makes a big difference. I feel like we're putting them out when we ask questions.
The beds are comfortable. Good sleep. 3 pillows each double bed. Linens clean. Adequate shower. Good flow, pressure.
I'd stay here again, as trying to stay in SF and get free parking, good beds, free breakfast, no charge for dogs @ working class prices, doesnt exist.
Staying in SSF isnt the worst. Grand Ave has stores & cafes, Peets for tea, coffee. But you certainly cant go for a night stroll around LaQuinta. Denny's is right next door - fair.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are pleasant. Despite the occasional spot of mold in the bathrooms, overall they're not bad. Non-smoking motel. Huge plus. Handicap parking!
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service. Regina and some of the cleaning staff are wonderful. Please, take the time to smile, welcome guests, act like you mean it, be proud.
review.locationRemarks: Not great. Nearest place to 'stroll, relax' - Grand Ave - but you need to drive the short distance.

review.title: Great time, best location and 100% clean!!!
Pleased Customer!
review.reviewText: I was pleased by my overall Hotel experience. It was conveniently located next to the 101 and made my travel such a convenience when I drove around San Francsico over the weekend. I must also advise that having the convenience of a Denny's located next to the Hotel made it a plus!!
review.negativeRemarks: No comment.

review.title: Disappointed with room conditions
review.reviewText: We rented 3 rooms. All 3 had mold in the shower, 1 had a slow drain for the bathroom sink and sveral of the rooms has towels that were very rough and could have used some type of softener or possibly the towels were too old and were past their file expectancy.
review.positiveRemarks: The management and help were very pleasant and apologized for the problems with the rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, better maintenance procedures for the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Our schedule included sight seeing in San Francisco and surronding areas.

review.title: Behind the railroad tracks
review.reviewText: La Quinta is two buildings. One is behind the railroad tracks. was in the building behind the railroad tracks. After experiencing this, I would ask to be in the main hotel building next time.
review.locationRemarks: La Quinta is within quick driving distance to San Francisco.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: There were problems with the heat/air conditioning, coffee maker, and cold water faucet in shower.

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: Bathroom and facility is very old and need to be renovated ASAP, breakfast is ok, not enough parking space, close to SFO, convenience location
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom

review.title: Hotel is Pet Friendly and that's what I am looking
review.reviewText: Very Good. Good breakfast, free internet and parking, and friendly staff.

review.title: good value given the area
review.reviewText: everything in SF is expensive, however I loved the location. good value, clean hotel, great breakfast and staff, could use a new coat of paint.

review.title: Nice hotel next to a train track.
review.reviewText: It was loud at times because it was close to the train.

review.title: Cleanliness
review.reviewText: Hotel was good, but service was very poor. Not a singlr day the room was cleaned or towels and linen changed. We had to ask repeatedly.
review.negativeRemarks: Service!!!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Lokation was very good.

review.title: Motel at affordable price close to the SFO.
review.reviewText:
The room was good enough for us and we may stay there again.
Parking is inadequate and if your are put up the annex and it is raining, it is a wet walk to the main building and to the breakfast as you, or you may not, find parking at the main building.

review.title: Convenient to airport.
review.reviewText: I left in my glasses in my room which I did not discover till on shuttle bus on way to airport. I called and they delivered them to the airport on next shuttle. Thanks!

review.title: Switched reservation from a non-smoking to smoking
review.reviewText: Very disappointing. Our reservation was switched from a non-smoking to a smoking room (thank goodness they at least removed the ashtrays). The entire room smelled awful, and then our belongings also picked up that smell. It was sickening. We were told when you book through Expedia you will have to take whatever is available and that all other rooms were taken. No a happy camper.
review.negativeRemarks: If you have a reservation for a specific type of room (bed size, non-smoking, accessible) DO NOT CHANGE the reservation if the party has not cancelled
review.locationRemarks: Anything to get out of the stinky room!!

review.title: It's far from a normal La Quinta
review.reviewText: This was a terrible hotel. They had 2 buildings seperated by 2 railroad tracks and not enough parking space. The place is old and needs to be renovated ASAP! This is far from any other La Quinta I've stayed at before. Requested a smoking room and got it without any ashtrays. Called and waited 45 mins before I called again and finally got them nearly a hour after inital call. There was a nasty sewage smell in the room as you enter. The toilet would not flush properly and caused the smell to come back up. Got a another room the next day. Took my ashtrays with me so I didn't have to wait a hour again. This place can use at least new paint and carpets in the room. The only new thing in this room was a 28" or 32" tv. The chairs had white stains on them. The only good thing about this place was the breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was the only good thing about this place.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything can be improved at this place.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Very industrial area (railroad tracks separate the hotel's two buildings), not a lot of food options nearby, shower was moldy.
review.negativeRemarks: Bleach, applied to the tiles in the shower, should clear up that mold. As it was, I preferred to wait a day and shower at home.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport and not much else.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Bart
review.reviewText: The hotel is easy access to the freeway which is nice. The Bart is also close too! Which is nice because I didn't want to pay for parking in SF, soo expensive! The room was nice, comfortable beds. Nice stay! :)

review.title: It was fine for close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The room was quiet and very close to the airport. The beds were comfortable - the bath tub was not completely clean but otherwise okay.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Airport very close.

review.title: Clean, inexpensive, easy for a one nighter.
review.reviewText: Quick check-in late at night from airport. Had breakfast and left for airport next morning.

review.title: Nice clean and close to Airport
review.reviewText: Great to stay the night before early departure from airport. Very clean and nice size. Comfy bed and newer ac units in room make it comfy..
review.locationRemarks: About 10 Min away theres a nice town to eat and walk

review.title: Nice stay.
review.reviewText: 1st room had broken a/c and a rough shower. second room was much better.
review.negativeRemarks: functionality
review.locationRemarks: not best for vacation, but good location for what I wanted

review.title: Easy Access to SFO
review.reviewText: Needed to be close to the airport for early morning flight and also wanted to be near options for nice restaurants and this hotel fits that bill.

review.title: Think twice before staying at this hotel
review.reviewText:
The Pluses:

They allow pets and have a decent breakfast
Housekeeping was friendly

The Negatives:

The hotel is situated next to an onion (yes,onion) processing facility on the west, BART on the north and the 101 fry on the east. Good luck trying to get some sleep or open your windows to get some air.

Other then the sucky location, the hotel is very dirty, my AC and heater did not work and when the wind blew, it made a very loud sound as it rushed in through the leaking windows and out the doors without proper weatherstripping. The carpet had more stains than my garage floor.

My hotel neighbor spent all day smoking pot and it drifted through the hallway, the dog across the hallway barked all night and no joke, my first night there, a couple girls were skinny-dipping in the pool - That almost made everything else OK.

Other than the above, its purrfect.
review.negativeRemarks: A major overhaul, a good power washing and paint job and maybe more attentive management to the overall conditions of the property.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the 101 and the airport

review.title: Close to Candlestick Park
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel, friendly staff close to Candlestick Park

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is right by the freeway, but it's pretty well insulated so noise wasn't too intrusive. The staff were great and the room was adequate. I didn't care for the bed though. It was too soft for me.

review.title: Good hotel near airport and rental car drop off
review.reviewText: Best rates found in area. Could not be closer and easier to drop off rental car at airport. Nice room. Well pleased with stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Very basic breakfast. Long line for the 3 waffle makers. Surprised how many people loved waffles.

review.title: Room and price go hand in hand
review.reviewText: The hotel is convienent closer to the 101 freeway and direct access to SF downtown. Morning breakfast is good but crowded. Be there early to get a table and avoid crowd. Altough is close to the freeway, the noise was minimal. I would recommend if you want to save some money and be relatively close to SF attractions
review.positiveRemarks: Ok room size, security in main entrance and price. Also, free WIFI is available and works
review.negativeRemarks: larger rooms and better breakfast options.
review.locationRemarks: 7 miles from SF downtown, therefore, close to all attractions in the city and easy access to 101 freeway

review.title: Construction next door and terrible bathrooms.
review.reviewText:
In short:

Construction next door canceled out anything pleasant.

Only one person working the front counter made the wait times for phone calls, assistance and check in / check out FAR TOO LONG (20+ minutes).

Bathroom was terrible. Shower curtains had mold on the bottom. The shower faucet and handles did not function well (Took 15 minutes to get warm water as opposed to extreme hot or cold.) The bathtub had a large recess down the center that made standing in it very awkward and uncomfortable.

Will not be using this hotel chain again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything mentioned above.
review.locationRemarks: Does not matter

review.title: Nice place with easy access to freeway.
review.reviewText: Everything was ok except that there was a whistling going through the duct work or something in the hall way out side the room that kept waking us up at night.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was easy to get to.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level at night from the whistling sound in the hall way.
review.locationRemarks: there was plenty of places to eat nearby.

review.title: Old Hotel in an industrial complex
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other La Quintas before and had great experiences. This time not so. The hotel is split by a set of train tracks the facilities are run down. The bathrooms have mold and rust on the ceilings and the staff when I arrived was in helpful and rude. The adjacent building is a food processing plant with a constantly full trailer of trash next door which smells lovely. I will not stay here ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: Proper maintaining and a lot of cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: Don't get ran over by the train walking from one half the hotel to the other

review.title: Overnite stay for early morning flight
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel near the airport. Pleasant and helpful staff with shuttle service to SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and convenient to the airport.

review.title: staff very considerate and pleasant

review.positiveRemarks: The staff was nice and, it turns out, honest.
review.negativeRemarks: Better soap
review.locationRemarks: Sf

review.title: I didn't like it
review.reviewText: They gave us a smoke room which I hated, all my clothes has that terrible smoke smell and I couldn't sleep comfortably
review.negativeRemarks: The smell

review.title: good to stay for short time and
review.reviewText: I stayed 2 nights and I didn't expect to have a lux place but for the amount of money I paid I would like to have a cleaner bathroom, the floor was not clean enough, and also the bathtub . over all it's a nice place just for short time.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaner bathrooms

review.title: Not happy with this stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is placed between a railroad, a freeway and a garbage processing facility (at maybe 20 feet from the road). The room was noisy. The staff was not helpful, actually we had to struggle and make phone calls to get a non-smokingroom (although I booked it non-smoking!). In the evening, it is very hard to find a parking spot at this hotel, because most of the place is taken by the "park and fly" customers. Will not return!
review.negativeRemarks: Many things! The location stinks. Staff should try to be more helpful! Reserved parking for hotel customers. Housekeeping stop knocking at 7 am...
review.locationRemarks: Denny's is right near the hotel which is convenient

review.title: Filthy
review.reviewText: The room was nice until I pull out the shower curtain. The shower wall, curtain and tub have mildew and molds. The bathroom floor and tub have hairs from previous guest. It took us changing 3 times to finally have a bathroom that was decent. We were completely grossed out by the filth. It was a good thing that we got there early enough to be able to change the room. The staff was kind and accommodated us.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a thorough cleaning and remove the molds and mildew.

review.title: Good choice for the Price
review.reviewText: I really liked our stay here, Parking was the only problem since all spots are full when we checked in by midnight. overall best choice of hotel for SFO.

review.title: Good as Usual
review.reviewText: price's good and the room was clean. its better if there are razor and toothbrush in the room
review.locationRemarks: the location is not bad even though its quite far from downtown. I could go a pizza shop, convenience store and bank driving 5min

review.title: Terrible Location
review.reviewText: Between the trains and the highway, the noise is enough to keep you up all night. I can't believe this hotel is in the La Quita chain. This ends my association with La Quinta.
review.negativeRemarks: Moving it to a new location

review.title: Close to everything, SFO.

Beds where soft and not hard like in other hotels, easy to get on and off of freeways. I went to downtown SSF and ate at a Thai restaurant that was incredible and great prices.
review.positiveRemarks: Area, close to everything and a Denny's right next door, just in case you miss the free continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix pool, they advertise heated pool and my son was unable to enjoy the pool.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SSF

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: the air condition did not working well even though my husband already tried it.The lowest only 66 F...And because the hotel to close to the airport so noisy.Everytime the aeroplane would like to landed ,we can hear it.
review.negativeRemarks: fix the AC

review.title: Last resort

review.negativeRemarks: Odor removal of hotel.

review.title: Nice and convenient hotel.
review.reviewText: Came and checked in with a nice greet and accommodated us with all of our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: N/a
review.locationRemarks: There is a Denny's next door, so that is always great.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel that was close to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport and very affordable
review.locationRemarks: Not sure only stayed for one night

review.title: Pleasant stay close to the airport.
review.reviewText: A weekend in San Francisco... nice, affordable place to stay.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, check in was prompt and the staff was courteous. However, once we got around to the back building where our room was located, our disappointment began to grow. Upon entering the building, there was a distinct odor of cigarette smoke. When we exited the elevator on our floor, the smell was overpowering. We had specifically requested a non-smoking room, however I do not believe they exist in this particular building. Our room smelled of smoke and was tidy, but the carpets were badly stained and the bathroom area was not the level of clean I would have expected. The morning following our arrival we were awaken at 7am by cigarette smoke so thick it made our throats burn. I reported this to the front desk but felt like I was blown off. Continental breakfast was virtually non existent at 8am when we arrived in the lobby so we went elsewhere. Overall quite disappointed. I expected better from this reputable hotel chain.
review.positiveRemarks: Ease of access to the freeway

review.title: Excellent place for holidays with family!
review.reviewText: I had my two pets with me and everything was great!

review.title: Nice, Updated Room
review.reviewText: I have a hard time sleeping on hotel beds, but this time was different. From the comfy mattress to the fluffy comforter, I drifted off to sleep immediately. The room was updated so I look forward to staying here again.
review.locationRemarks: Very easy access to the hub of San Francisco.

review.title: very bad
review.reviewText: bath tub was blocked, water could not drain out. inspite of informing the fornt desk, it was not taken care .

review.title: La Quinta experience.
review.reviewText: The staff was nice and friendly. Got me checked in promptly.
review.locationRemarks: There's a Denny's right next to the Hotel & a KFC/Taco Bell, right up the street. So, of you don't want to order room service you have a few options.

review.title: Close to the airport and very basic.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very basic and is not that clean. The staff-- one lady was very nice and the other completely did not care about service.

review.title: Cars and Trains!
review.reviewText:
I was disappointed to find that this older property was sandwiched between the Freeway and the CalTrain tracks, right next to a packing plant!

While the staff was great, the overall facilities were getting less that great maintenance. The outside door closest to my room never accepted my keycard and I had to talk to another door and walk back to my room.

There was just a one cup at a time coffee maker in the room. No refrigerator, microwave, etc. There wasn't even a plug for the drain in the bathtub.

The morning "Continental Breakfast" ended at 8:45am and was way too small to provide ample room for the crowds that were trying to us use the room. Many of the bins were empty and there was just two small toasters for a big crowd.

Finally, the street outside the hotel was divided and you had to drive quite a ways down the street, do a U-Turn, and drive all the way back to get on the freeway.

NOT up to the usual La Quinta standard!!
review.negativeRemarks: More attention to exterior maintenance.

review.title: basic hotel near airport
review.reviewText: This hotel has a nice breakfast in the morning, the rooms were clean and had the basic neccessities. If you are looking for a no frills stay- then this place is fine. The rooms could be updated along with the bathrooms but honestly if you just need a place to clean up and get some rest it is adequate. The pool was freezing in July! Yet that is not something they can control unless they put in a heater- the weather in SF is not something they can change. The hot tub was- just that, a hot tub. It has a maximum capacity of 4 persons so that was odd. Other than that it was just fine. Our 8 year old was a little dissapointed in the pool offerings so next time we will look for an indoor pool to relax by.
review.locationRemarks: Not too far away is some great restaurants- less then a mile on Grand Avenue. Vietnamese was spot on at Ben Tre and then we also hit DiNapoli-great!

review.title: for the money
review.reviewText: yes has poor location but easy to get anywhere and great value no parking fees and breakfast again 4 the Money great value
review.positiveRemarks: easy to all things 1 or 3 miles to several chain resturants chiles red robin outback and only 1/2 miles to many ethinic resturants so sf
review.negativeRemarks: bigger romms !!!
review.locationRemarks: train runs by it but hey had worse

review.title: Airport location, moldiest bathroom in existence!
review.reviewText: Picked this location for the proximity to the airport, was an older La Quinta, smelled of smoke. I am not a prude and have had to stay in many undesirable location from my time in the military. But the worst was the bathroom, grout was black, should have been white. But under the rubber mat in the tub was black mold, it washed out when you showered.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the place on occasion.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: I used to stay in La Quinta's a few years ago for work and they were just fine. My recent stay proved very disappointing. Everything is run down, the smell is old and moldy, although the carpet had been replaced in the room, the walls were full of stains and mysterious things stuck on them. The bathroom was full of mold on the ceiling. The breakfast was very mediocre....no juice or fresh fruit. Overall, I would never stay there again.

review.title: Nice bed
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay if you need close to airport. The bed was comfortable and wifi was easy to get connected to. Wish it had a restaurant though
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Didn't leave room. Had to fly out next morning

review.title: Very clean
review.reviewText: Hotel was great price was great we had a nice stay. The breakfast was good and the hotel staff was very nice. Will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the free breakfast, the room was very clean, easy to check in and out, staff very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs heated pool.

review.title: Old, run down hotel
review.reviewText: I wish I would have researched this hotel more before making my reservation. It was old and run down. It is in desperate need of renovation. The floors were dirty and carpets really needed shampooed. We checked in late and left early. The two hotel staff I dealt with were both professional and polite.

review.title: Close to transportation, clean & comfortable.
review.reviewText: Both my family and myself were very satisfied. Even though there was not a full breakfast buffet, they had and OJ and apple juice machine, coffee machine, hard boiled eggs for protein, yogurt, bagels and a waffle bar! They mailed my post cards for me. When we called the front desk for more towels they were very prompt. When we called them to come look at our A/C unit they maintenance man showed up right away and it turns out we just didn't know how to operate it...
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and transportation.

review.title: One overnight before flying
review.reviewText: We got a great nights sleep and good breakfast before flying. The staff member upon checkout was very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: comfort of the beds, nice breakfast, proximity to airport, shuttle service
review.negativeRemarks: The staff was not especially friendly when we checked in. It makes a big difference in the.feeling of your stay if the staff are very welcoming.

review.title: Bad location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in the same parking lot as a produce factory and the area smelled.
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast in one word SUCKED! The coffee machine wasnt working the orange juice looked like water.
review.locationRemarks: there was NOTHING nearby to do!

review.title: Pleasantly surprised with La Quinta Inn, SF.
review.reviewText:
Overall good experience staying @ La Quinta Inn in SF, near SFO. It was during a heat wave when we stayed, and our room faced north so we got a lovely breeze. The beds were very comfortable, linens super clean, fresh & new. Slept well.
Unfortunately the outside of the windows was very dirty, grimy, so the view was occluded a bit.
Great grassy area for the dogs, but hotel staff didn't maintain the garbage, nor supply poop bags. We always keep a supply but for those who didn't, the poop didn't get picked up. Not cool.
Noisy at times, right next to the freeway. Plus night time noise was a bit chaotic several times. Handicapped parking was tough at night, very frustrating since I cant walk far.
review.positiveRemarks: Bright, airy hotel with a lovely, relaxing entry way. Very freeway accessible. Free parking. Good shower pressure. Nice towels.
review.negativeRemarks: Add more handicapped parking. Plus, nobody should be parking along the edges of the hotel where the signs state - NO PARKING, FIRE ZONE. Stupid.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the town of South San Francisco. Eateries on Grand Ave. DONT EAT AT DENNY'S. Worst service ever.

review.title: Just wanted to hang out in room and watch tv
review.reviewText: We were able to get what we wanted and even though the hotel did not have a restrauant we were able to order food to the room, very nice and the staff did not bother us as we just wanted to hang out in the room. Denny's was close by so we went there several times to eat which was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Located in an ok location for us.
review.negativeRemarks: I like to stay where there is a bar and restrauant
review.locationRemarks: We did not look into what to do near by we just wanted to rest and hang out..

review.title: Late Arrival
review.reviewText:
We used this hotel for a late night arrival into SFO. It was very convenient to the airport and price was great.

We didn't take advantage of the breakfast and ate at the Denny's in the lot instead. Would recommend but not for more than a night pre or post travel.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to the second building is awkward. Lack of parking.
review.locationRemarks: arrive or leave from SFO. Convenient to 101 and Candlestick.

review.title: To visit sf state college
review.reviewText: Clean, close to freeway, but the lack of parking is really bad.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking

review.title: Inexpensive hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: The room smelled like someone had smoked in it and they had tried to cover up the scent. The bathroom needed to be cleaned a little better. There were a few strands of hair left on the shower wall. Not massively unclean, just like it had been cleaned in a hurry and not enough care to catch the little things. The staff was exceptionally friendly. Front desk when I checked in and out were very helpful. The north building is a bit of a walk from the lobby. That presented a little bit of a challenge when I had just come from the airport with a lot of luggage. Still, overall the price was right and the room was clean enough. I'd stay there again if I had to.
review.negativeRemarks: Room could be cleaned a bit better
review.locationRemarks: Denny's restaurant in the parking lot

review.title: Convenience to customer sites, and airport.
review.reviewText: Clean, excellent price, close to the airport, and work sites. Breakfast could have a little more Varity
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like the the rail tracks.
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.title: Not as advertised
review.reviewText: Parking lot full due to hotel's "park and ride" program; people were parking in fire lanes because there was no parking. NOT SAFE!!! Hot tub and pool were dirty from cigarettes and trash. Elevators rattled and shook, sounded like they were falling apart. Entire hotel was dirty/very worn. The breakfast served was good; included waffles, juices, yogurt, some fruits, coffee, cereal, and milk.
review.negativeRemarks: Wash the walls and windows. Clean the pool and hot tub. Take care of current customers -- not those who flew away. Get better quality towels.
review.locationRemarks: Right by the airport, train station, and interstate. Great if you want to travel somewhere else and aren't sticking around to listen to it all.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: It was the last room in San Francisco at the airport. We had a very nice room and they had a great breakfast in the lobby. The only downfall is that if you have to stay in the separate building in the back, it wasn't a very safe looking area at night. It is right next door to a warehouse. Parking could also be a problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Available parking
review.locationRemarks: Location is a little iffy.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: The room was fine, everything you need is there. No microwave or fridge.
review.positiveRemarks: It was not far away from SFO, about 25-30 min drive , close to a city Pacifica with an acess to the ocean . Close to different restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: the toilet was not working right , it was plugged and it took us 3 times to call to a front desk before and 2 days to wait before it was fixed.
review.locationRemarks: Next to a freeway, sfo airport and restaurants . Our favorite was El Torrito. You must go there ! It's about 10 min drive from a hotel .

review.title: Just what I needed
review.reviewText: Close to airport to return rental car, close to all attractions and was quiet and restful stay
review.positiveRemarks: helpfulness of employees and the fact they had an onsite laundry
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman Wharf. downtown San Fransico

review.title: Clean hotel, but no available parking.
review.reviewText:
To make it short. It took us 45 minutes to find a parking spot. After complaining to the staff, they showed no sympathy only to say that the parking is also for people going on trips.
The tv in our room was broken and they couldn't fix it or replace it. That was very inconvenient nt when you have two kids in the room with you.

review.title: GOOD ENOUGH FOR ONE NIGHT
review.reviewText:
THE BREAKFAST WAS NOT GOOD. BAGELS AND OTHER BREAD WERE THE WORST. POOR SELECTION OF CEREAL. NO BANANAS.

HAD TROUBLE PARKING ON HOTEL PROPERTY. NO SPACE.
review.positiveRemarks: THE ROOM WAS CLEAN AND REASONABLY COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN.
review.negativeRemarks: SEE ABOVE.

review.title: No parking ...separate bldg a block away
review.reviewText:
Got on late..2 am..cold and tired and on pain. Unloaded all bags.. told that our room is in separate building...down long hall and across parking lot around fence. Not only no parking by our bldg but no parking at all because they let people leave cars there when they go to airpot. That would be fine if there was parking for their PAYING clientele.
TWICE my key would not work. I have pain issues and had to walk all way to other bldg and around to front to get jey.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Everything was good the rooms are very quiet big and clean, but they dont have enough parking when we woke up there were cars parked everywere, it was crazy, but over all it was great.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Nothing to write home about but nothing to complain about either. All the basic amenities are there. The room is clean but fairly small. The front desk receptionist could have been a little more friendly and the parking was way too difficult(we had to park at Dennys because the parking lot was full!) for the location but overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to save some money during a San Francisco trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: 18 minutes to Downtown San Francisco.

review.title: I was disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the airport,but close to noisy and active working place (a produce company). There is nothing good about the hotel. You can hear very loud winds in the room and corridor, stinky towels and elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: The price compared to other hotels
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanless
review.locationRemarks: Not a well located hotel. Very close to the airport.

review.title: Trains and Parking problems
review.reviewText: A somewhat seedy industrial neighborhood, adjacent to some sort of food factory. Trains were passing by at least every 30 minutes including a freight train loading up loudly in the wee hours of the morning. Tracks were within 50 feet of the hotel. Large, clean hotel but most of the cars were parked there long term which made finding a space almost impossible, even in the late morning when you would think people had cleared out. Guests had to circle the hotel in the hopes of finding parking, then, like me had to ask the front desk staff where to park. We were all told we could use the Denny's parking lot but there was no parking there either. Crazy. This driving endlessly around the parking lot never stopped as new guests arrived. Will not be staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: adding about 200 more parking spaces
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do nearby except get to the airport. I sure wouldn't want to be out walking in the neighborhood.

review.title: Parking was not great.
review.reviewText: Parking was terrible we had to circle around at least 5 times and I called the front desk twice just to tell them that we couldn't find parking and they said it was ok to park in red zone which we didn't feel comfortable with and we had no fridge in our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking needs to be improved

review.title: Nice room
review.reviewText: I appreciated the dog friendly room for my stay. Surprised with the large size of the room. Enjoyed the pool.
review.locationRemarks: Ok, close to freeway.

review.title: Short stay
review.reviewText: We were there just for the night and have to rush off to the airport at 5am. So, we did not have the opportunity to check their breakfast. Wonder if they could provide some simple breakfast to take away for people leaving early. Nevertheless, the room is comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great Hotel for a Buss traveller as well as Family
review.reviewText: Nice family type hotel next to the Airport with minimum noise. Loved the breakfast, except weekly time should be extended until 10 AM.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Hard to find
review.reviewText: Navigation on my phone had a hard time finding this hotel. The condition of the room was fine although it was very noisy with strong wind.
review.negativeRemarks: Some traffic control for breakfast??
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport. We found good Japanese restaurant within walking distance.

review.title: Ok stay
review.reviewText: I checked in late at night and was given a room in another building behind the hotel. It was a few minute walk over railroad tracks dragging all of my luggage. The front desk did have security escort me and then called to be sure I was in my room

review.title: I was very comfortable and felt safe.
review.reviewText: I was there to visit friends and relatives. The hotel is very convenient to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Indoor pool!

review.title: Mother's Day weekend - Stay was decent
review.reviewText:
Pros:
-Room was really clean.. (Bathroom had a few rust stains but thats normal wear & tear i guess) despite that, the place felt clean which is big to me. :)))))
-Staff was pretty friendly. Had no problems at all.
-Complimentary breakfast was great. My family enjoyed it.

Cons:
-Area is near airport & train tracks so if you're a sensitive sleeper like my mom is, its kind of hard to get a complete goodnights rest.
-The hotel has two different buildings. The main building & their extension in the back. Across the train tracks. It's nearby so u can walk but it would be annoying if you had to walk with all of your luggage. We were in the extension.
-Parking sucks at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide assistance to those who need to take luggage to back building. Invest in "Golf cart" or vehicle that will help people.
review.locationRemarks: Dennys. Nearby freeway. Near airport.

review.title: Be Cautious
review.reviewText: There are TWO buildings to this hotel. They put me in the second builiding - which is in a dark unlit industrial area and you have to walk over train tracks to get to second building. Also the BART is at the airport - so ifyou want to take the BART in to SF, you have to take the airport shuttle to the airport - and vice versa.
review.negativeRemarks: The two buildings and BART transportation need to be more clearly spelled out....

review.title: Perfect for travelers needing airport access
review.reviewText: The La Quinta Inn South San Fran was perfect for our last night of vacation after a beautiful week in Sonoma wine country, before catching our planes. For the value price, and the fact that the hotel was able to accommodate us on providing adjoining rooms for our other party that traveled with us, as well as the airport shuttle that runs every 1/2 hour from 4am to midnight, we could not have asked for a better experience. The hotel itself seems older, but the rooms were clean, attractive and furnished with nice beds, modern tv, and everything we needed.

review.title: Just Ok to stay for a Day. Not for More than that.
review.reviewText: I am Business Traveler. Hotel Pics were nice on Expedia so i choose this hotel but it turened out to be not so great.No Trash can in the bathroom. Staff was nice at the Reception. Breakfast is not so great as you would expect. No Scrambled eggs or beef patties. Eggs are not peeled off. Bath rooms are not well maintained. Paints coming off. There are better hotels at the same price in South SFO. As far toiletries there was just a bar soap and a shampoo.
