review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco. 20 Airport Blvd

review.title: Good luck finding parking
review.reviewText:
The hotel was pet friendly, reasonably priced, and conveniently located. However, parking after 9pm or so is a nightmare. When I got back in around 1am, all available spots were taken and well over a dozen cars were parked in fire lanes and other no parking zones. Staff instructed me to park in a space reserved for a nearby business, insisting - contrary to the signs - that I would not be towed. Thankfully, I wasn't, but I would have slept better without the worry of whether my car would be there in the morning.

Overall, I'd recommend it for pet lovers, and anyone who doesn't plan on getting in or staying out late.
review.positiveRemarks: Pet friendly, with no fee for my dog
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Family
review.reviewText:
The staff were very polite. The breakfast was just your basic eggs, waffles, cereal, fruit, etc.
The only thing they didn't say was there is a transit train that goes by the hotel until about 8:00pm and starts again at 6:00am. The parking is very minimal but overall, I would stay again.

review.title: Very family friendly and quiet.
review.reviewText: We utilize this hotel once a year for a mini family reunion. The hotel is so nice in letting us use their public room for this. We try our best to leave it in the beautful condition we got it, The rooms looked like they were freshly renovated with new paint and bed covers. A lovely hotel that is afoordable and family friendly. We will see them again in the summer.
review.negativeRemarks: In this last trip all the room doors were being painted. No signs were anywhere noting this, thus, got paint on my brand new blouse.

review.title: florence
review.reviewText: parking lot was a zoo. arrived at 9 pm and took one hour to park on a friday night. not enough lots to accommodate guests. we ended up parking in front of trash bin after approval from an employee. decent breakfast... lots of people once again.

review.title: Dog Friendly Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: La Quinta Inn is situated just north of San Francisco International Airport. It is a very dog friendly hotel-- no surcharge if you are bringing Fido. Rooms are very clean, beds are comfortable. Rooms are also big-- there was enough floor space for my dog's large folding kennel. The included breakfast is also good-- cereal, fresh fruits, waffle, toast, coffee, tea, OJ and milk.

review.title: Good hotel near city
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for only one night on a weekend. The location was convenient to places of interest inside San Francisco, only 10 miles to downtown. The hotel is a bit worn out due to age, but great place to stay for overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom is old
review.locationRemarks: Too close to freeway

review.title: Great SFO airport stop over hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older property. but well maintained. My husband and I had just returned from SE Asia (a very long flight). So rather than continuing on to Portland, OR., we stayed the night in SFO. The shuttle is very timely, every 30 min. (free) and the free breakfast is really great considering the price point for this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our overnight at La Quinta. Additionally, there is a Denny's Restaurant right in parking lot, so if you need lunch or dinner it is handy too and inexpensive with good service.
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport, free breakfast, free internet and nice size of room.
review.negativeRemarks: freeway noise, but we were so tired it really didn't matter.
review.locationRemarks: right by freeway, close to airport

review.title: not gonna stay again
review.reviewText: we were given a room in differt bldg so I have to cross a RAILROAD TRACK with bags. And there was nobody to help me. lotel is next to a factory which is running all night so in a very weird atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: railroad track

review.title: Great for the airport access
review.reviewText: Just don't order out from the La Quinta Menu, The Ceasar Salad was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Kinfd of wierd behind the warehouse, trucks unloading & accross the tracks

review.title: Not enough hotel parking spots for customers!
review.reviewText:
In spite of the fact that we paid a decent amount for our stay, we were not happy about the quality of the service in the hotel for the following reasons:

1. Not enough hotel parking spots for customers. After driving around the hotel parking four or five times (We also witnessed numerous other customers who were doing the same), we finally asked the front disk staff for guidance. She suggested that we park in the Denny’s parking, which is located next to the hotel. When we checked about this with the manager at Denny’s, of course she disagreed. We didn’t want to risk our car being towed. We finally parked in front of the hotel in the fire lane upon the recommendation of the front desk. It was a very stressful experience after traveling long hours.
2. We were assigned to a smoking room although we reserved for a non-smoking room. The room was really disgusting. The carpet had many dirty spots. After just spending one night in this room, our clothes, including our jackets, smelled very strongly of cigarettes. All of us found ourselves coughing.
3. The toilet’s was not working. When we called the front disk, no one came to help us for a long while. When we called a second time, the security guard came to our room and handed us a toilet plunger! We do not blame the people at the front desk or the security guard. We simply think it was poor management.

We strongly warn other customers who are planning to stay at this hotel, especially during a busy time of the year.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, Smoking Room, Toilet

review.title: Awful experience!
review.reviewText:
We had a awful experience for all the following reasons:
At first, we requested a non-smoking room (I have a 10 month baby) and they gave us a smoking room. I had to call directly to expedia.com to make the room change possible because the hotel's staff were not open to give us a solution. Thanks to expedia.com the change was possible.
The city train rail is located a few meter from the hotel and you can heard it from the rooms.
To go to the main building (for instance for breakfast) you have to get out of the building and walk several blocks.
The surrounding areas of the hotel are full of trucks and next to it is a factory.
The bath tub was very unclean.
The heater on the room was very noisy and it was difficult to manage it.
Breakfast was gone very fast and it was very poor.

And the worst part, the hotel's staff does give you any support.
review.locationRemarks: Very noisy location

review.title: Great family hotel, good deal.
review.reviewText:
Great family hotel, good deal.
Great family hotel, good deal.

review.title: A clean place near the airport
review.reviewText: My husband and I have stayed here many times. It is reasonably priced, the rooms and buildings are always clean, the manager is very nice to deal with and best of all, the parking is free. We once tried to stay at a fancier place and they wanted $20 to park our car! This hotel is only a mile away from the airport so it is very convenient if you get in very late or need to get there very early, which is when we stay there. I would definitely recommend it and, as I said, continue to go back there to spend the night when I need to get to the airport at an unreasonable time.
review.positiveRemarks: that it is clean, nice manager, and free parking
review.negativeRemarks: sometimes the parking lot is full, but they are easy about letting you park on the red
review.locationRemarks: it is very convenient to the airport, but that is the only reason to stay in this location

review.title: Typical La Quinta hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay - we flew into San Francisco at 11pm at night and left at 7am the next morning and just needed a place to crash. This is a nice hotel - it's not 5 star accomadations, but I also wasn't paying 5 star prices. I wouldn't want to stay here all week, but it serves its purpose. I would stay again.

review.title: last resort
review.reviewText: It served a purpose. Allowed the dog and was just ok.

review.title: Great for waiting for that early morning flight
review.reviewText: Some people have complained about the airplanes.....FYI you are next to the airport. This is a GREAT place to stay to catch that early morning flight. It is a nice place and I have never, in my three stays, had any problems with comfort, cleanliness or service.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO and has shuttle service
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO and has shuttle service. There is a Denny's in the same parking lot for convenient meals.

review.title: Not so great!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice but was noisey When we got to our room, it smelled like wet dog and patches on the carpet were wet. Every morning we woke up, the carpet and bathroom floor were wet and out clothes were moist.I called the operator to ask for additional towels and it took 30 minutes for me to realize they still hadn't come to deliver them. I walked to the front desk and asked and the lady told me to call from my room.. Finally after an hour, i received 2 additional towels to go in the hot tub. Got to the pool area and the hot tub was green:they forgot to put chlorine in the pools..... It was the most awful hotel experience we have ever had. Would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine but wouldn't stay there again. Clean but uncomfortable with location.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't really care for the annex. Had to go over the railroad tracks. Completely separate building.

review.title: Great place to stay for a weekend event :)
review.reviewText: My roommates and I stayed at this hotel for an event in San Francisco over the weekend. The staff was very friendly. The building it self kept very clean. Parking was adaquate. Would definitely recommend to anyone!
review.positiveRemarks: Great service, above average free continental breakfast, Internet was fast/free.
review.negativeRemarks: I have no complaints about this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, located right by the highway. Near food, including Denny's right in the same parking lot.

review.title: Not very pleased
review.reviewText: We got put in the annex building behind the main hotel. The entry area had a very strong odor of marijuana and the room, although clean, reeked of cigarette smoke. We got in late so there were no parking spaces at the back bldg which left us no choice but to park at the main bldg and walk next to an old industrial bldg and over railroad tracks to the annex bldg.
review.negativeRemarks: Room reeked of cigarette smoke odor
review.locationRemarks: Annex was inconvenient

review.title: Great if you're on the correct side of the hotel
review.reviewText: Upon check-in there was only one attendant. She took an inordinate time with one couple. Our room was very clean, beds clean, shower sink clean, etc. But one big problem with this hotel was the noice outside my window beginning at about 11pm on to 2am was the train activity. Multiple trains coming and going. Then the stopping of the trains with all their racket from brakes and the cars running into each other. I didn't fall asleep until about 3am.
review.negativeRemarks: Trains coming and going in the we hours of the morning

review.title: Conveniently close to San Francisco International
review.reviewText: Very nive hotel close to SFO, Shuttle bus runs every half hour. There is a Denny's restaurant across the parking lot.
review.locationRemarks: One mile from SFO

review.title: ok to rest you head for the night
review.reviewText: Little hard getting into and out of the hotel. There was a median that you had to do U turns to get into the hotel. I requested a non-smoking room and had a floor with smoking on it.
review.negativeRemarks: getting onto and out of
review.locationRemarks: Right down from the airport

review.title: Great place for the price.
review.reviewText: Good for what it is. Stayed there for 5 days. Mini-fridge and microwave in room.
review.negativeRemarks: No "To Go" Coffee Cups :(

review.title: Only minutes away from 9er and Giants games!!!!
review.reviewText: Great time, great location for all things San Francisco! Go Giants!!! Breakfast was very nice ( I have got to get one of those waffle makers!). Only suggestion - Put a plunger in all 2nd and beyond floors. As a, "on the road" hotel person, it's always a problem with upper plumbing. Overall, I'll stay here next time I'm in town!! nEnjoy

review.title: Trip
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the $$. Room was clean and good bed.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Surprisingly good value - very pleasant. Safe, clean and good location. For teh price much better than many other options.
review.positiveRemarks: SAfety, cleanliness adn help of desk staff etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Is located on two sides of RR track- one building does not have desk staff
review.locationRemarks: very good for airport

review.title: Convenient Location To Airport
review.reviewText:
Great location to get to the airport. Cooperative staff. Clean and comfortable room. Convenient area to print airline boarding passes.

The only thing that we had trouble with was the water control for the shower. It was hard to get the right temperature and hard to turn off. The setup of the bathroom area could have used another door to the sink area for privacy.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom setup
review.locationRemarks: In industrial area, but neat. Easy to get to airport

review.title: Good value for price.
review.reviewText: This hotel has two buildings: the main building is nicer. To reach the back building you have to pass a smelly warehouse and the railroad tracks so it feels more isolated. I was initially given a smoking room although I had requested a non-smoking room. Luckily, the front desk clerk was nice enough to switch my room even though the hotel was completely booked for the night. The hotel was fine for an over-nite stay
review.locationRemarks: Right off the 101 Freeway by the airport. Only a Denny's restaurant nearby.

review.title: Good bargain.
review.reviewText: The odor from the produce processing plant next door is unpleasant.

review.title: Great Breakfasts
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very convenient, and fantastic free breakfast!!
review.positiveRemarks: free wifi, free parking and free great b'fast
review.negativeRemarks: railway line
review.locationRemarks: good, very convenient ... but need a GPS

photos.caption: Separate room with bath and toilet

review.title: We'll Defintely Be Back ....
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel a few times now. The beds are comfortable; rooms are well kept. The bathrooms are clean as well. Even though the complimentary breakfast is considered "continental", they still have a good assortment of items (oatmeal, make your own waffles, fruits, yogurt, bagels, pastries, bread, coffee, juice, etc.). There's also a Denny's right next to the hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families, as it is a pet-friendly hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, complimentary breakfast, and pet-friendly
review.locationRemarks: Kind of strange because it's next to a produce warehouse

review.title: bargain for San Fran
review.reviewText: Economical and practical. No parking charge, free shuttle service, quiet yet only a mile or so from the airport. The best bargain for a clean room .

review.title: Got Smoke?
review.reviewText: I specifically requested a non-smoking room, for two nights, booked through Expedia. On our first night we were given a room that was so redolent of smoke that it provided a VERY bad night's sleep. The best that could be said is that it wasn't actually ON fire, but it was gagging me. Even the towels reeked. The hotel told me it was Expedia's fault that we didn't get a smoke-free room. The second night we were moved to a smoke-free room. Much better. There was no fridge or microwave, and TV had only basic cable. NOT worth the cost. NEVER again!
review.negativeRemarks: Stinking smokey room after specifying non-smoking.

review.title: Reasonable price for a family.
review.reviewText: It was easy to find the hotel and it has a clean room and the breadfast was good enough for the price.

review.title: Worst Stay Ever!
review.reviewText:
I can not tell you how disappointed I was in this hotel!! This had to be the worst hotel ever. Would not recommend to anyone and worst of all this hotel was right next some type of produce trash hauling company. Walking back to our rooms that had been in the second building my family had to walk passs large tractor trailers filed with produce waste material thank goodness it was cold out. Another issue wit the hotel was they had two separate buildings and you had to cross two sets of railroad tracks. Thank goodness they had not been working but still a pain pul suitcase across in the early morning hours.
All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The employees at the hotel had been great! Very unlike the hotel itself.
review.negativeRemarks: Needed to be clean!!!
review.locationRemarks: Trouble in the middle of a Ppoduce trash hauling company and a working train that runs most of the night.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: For an overnight stay it was all we could want. Clean and very comfortable beds and despite concerns being so close to noise from trains and planes we heard nothing and slept well. Great waffles for breakfast.

review.title: Pet Friendly
review.reviewText: Pet Friendly. However, the room we stayed in is showing its age. Compared to the La Quinta at North Las Vegas, the room is smaller.
review.negativeRemarks: Aging

review.title: Great hotel for a smoker; not for a light sleeper!
review.reviewText: Your first smell as you enter the building is stale cigarette smoke. You open the room and it continues to smell like a smoke filled bar. We asked the front desk for another non-smoking room and they moved us to another room after spraying Febreeze. It was better for a couple hours. The first room had personal hair and dirt on the floor and in the bath tub. Although the hotel has two buildings separated by a railroad track, the trains were not very loud inside the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Smokey rooms separated by a railroad track.

review.title: Other Building
review.reviewText: Our room was in the other building behind the main building. You had to walk through the parking lot and over railroad tracks to get there. The room was very small and the bathroom needed updating. The breakfast was not to the level of other La Quinta's.
review.negativeRemarks: Staying in the other building.

review.title: Not as nice as other La Quinta hotels.
review.reviewText: I usually have good luck with La Quinta hotels, but this one was rather old and dilapidated.

review.title: Very convenient to San Fran airport
review.reviewText: Shuttle service to airport was convenient. Good breakfast (fresh waffles). The room had a slight smell to it. Hotel was fine, but there are actually two buildings and we stayed in the one farthest away from the lobby. We actually had to go outside and crossrailroad tracks to get to our room.

review.title: Decent hotel for a family
review.reviewText: La Quinta was much better than some of the reviews stated. Check in was quick and easy. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly in making sure my requests were met (I was able to get a crib and accommodate my dog at no extra charge). Room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nothing out of this world but definitely was ideal for a family; and making waffles was fun for the kids. There was always available parking though I imagine those who arrive after a late night out may find it a problem. Check-out was a breeze. Overall, we had no complaints and would stay here again!

review.title: Great place to stay even for a day.
review.reviewText: Well kept room. Wish we could have stayed longer. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have better if there's a microwave & a small refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find.

review.title: Pleasent stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is super excellent. The staff are very friendly, the location is not that good but not that bad
review.negativeRemarks: location and train road
review.locationRemarks: need some improvement

review.title: SPEND THE EXTRA $20!!! Get a real room!
review.reviewText: From the continental breakfast that was a room packed with guests waiting in line for a do it your self waffle maker and a piece of bread to the "Other building" on the other side of the railroad tracks from the main building. I literally had a crack head jump in front of my car on the railroad tracks. I greatly regret not just spending the extra $20 a night to get a hotel that would have provided a better environment for my daughter on our vacation to the best city on the world.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were in pretty good shape and the beds were comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Poor outside environment, and a breakfast that should be illegally considered to be continental.
review.locationRemarks: terrible

review.title: Separate Building Calamity
review.reviewText: I booked La Quinta SF Airport so my friend and I could have a place to rest before taking a 6 a.m. flight back home. Although I booked this room in April they placed us in the back building, a long-distance walk from the lobby to our room, past industrial buildings, trucks and over 4 sets of railroad tracks. They offered no other transportation options but foot power. I was very upset because we got in late in the evening and had to walk in the dark through the area described above back to our room after having a light supper at Denny's. Although a shuttle was available beginning at 4 a.m., the shuttle didn't come back to this solitary building and I was astonished. How could we get ourselves and luggage back to the main building by 4 a.m. ourselves? The staff, in their favor, did provide a taxi to pick us up at 3:45 a.m. to take us to the airport. But first my friend had to reveal that she couldn't walk because of her artificial leg, which was embarrassing for her. What more is there to say.....I won't stay at this hotel again!

review.title: There are better deals to be found.
review.reviewText: Room was hot but the AC wasn't working. They said they needed a part.I go to open a window and I find there is a warehouse next door that operates all freakin' night with forklifts beeping and banging & clanging going on. The police helicopter going around all night was a nice touch as well. Bathroom had some mildew growing in the tub and the tub itself was not very safe with its V shaped floor and no mat to prevent slippage. They did promise to send me a voucher for 1 free night so we'll see if they follow through. I do have to say the staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Warehouse noise, poor bathroom upkeep, vending machines ate cash, cheap quality coffee in room (dishwater).
review.locationRemarks: It sucks. Close to freeway though.

review.title: Wonderfull stay
review.reviewText: A group of 41 people from Turkey stayed here for 2 nights.Everything was very nice.Thanks to staff.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Shower curtain had mold on the bottom, slippery tub needs mat and average size rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great, near San Fran and shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel to stay..
review.reviewText: good hotel for the price..not so bad..comfort..close to airport

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText:
Staff was accommodating and the hotel was convenient to the airport. However, there are 2 separate hotel areas for this particular hotel and the North area is a short walking distance from the main hotel where the check-in is located and the breakfast area.

The hotel could have been cleaner as far as stains on the bedspread and the bathtub area and some water stains on the ceiling in the bathroom. Noisy as the local public BART (Bay Area Rapid Transportation) system is located right outside the hotel, which woke me up throughout the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and noise level of the public BART system.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport

review.title: Good old cheap hotel
review.reviewText: Good old hotel. The bathroom exhaust fan in my room is very loud. The lavatory has scratch and bad smell even we ask them to clean. This is not the critical issues. Breakfast is so little with breads, eggs, coffee and teas. This hotel is still ok for overall with the price.
review.negativeRemarks: clean

review.title: Comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. The free wifi even worked well enough for me to watch a streaming show online, which usually isn't the case at similar hotels. The only problem I had was with the lobby computer which ran incredibly slowly and wouldn't print out the boarding pass for my flight. The front desk agent was incredibly helpful by printing the pass for me, so I appreciated that.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, free airport shuttle running every 1/2 hour as opposed to every hour, free wifi that actually worked.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby computer that wouldn't print out my boarding pass.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport.

review.title: Deficiency
review.reviewText:
Deficiency
staff on front desk not good, provide microwave and fridge in rooms

review.title: Smoking room
review.reviewText: Requested a non-smoking room but got a smoking room and it smelled very bad.

review.title: Cool trip!
review.reviewText: I had a great time! I would definitely stay there again. Thanks, Expedia, you are the best at what you do!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find and right off the freeway

review.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in
review.reviewText: worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Stinky rooms, terrible accomodations, shower and toilet not working.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: the hotel is conveniently located close to the airport. It's a bit old, but it's clean. Good price including the breakfast. I would recommend it.

review.title: Poor Location.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are very nice. Breakfast was good. One thing we didn't like is the Produce warehouse next door. It is closed on the weekends. So that's good. It is next to the railroad tracks also. The tracks closest to the hotel are not functioning and it seems only the CalTrain ran on the other track. The rooms are split between two buildings, one on the other side if the tracks. The breakfast bar is in the main building. Parking was also minimal and the lot was usually full, which made you park at Denny's. Not a bad hotel for the price, but these are considerations to take into account. Next time I would not stay here.

review.title: Good hotel with good breakfast.
review.reviewText:
Its a nice hotel. However I have a little bit problem this which I have a non-smoking room surrounding by the smoking room. All the isle smell smoking fragrance.
At least I have stayed in at this hotel more then 3 times up to this day.
Hopefully it will be more carefully about this.
Over all is good.

review.title: beware the free parking
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for the free parking amenity. It was very crowded and our room was in the annex across a set of railroad tracks. It was over a ten minute walk dragging our luggage in the rain to get back to the lobby for the airport shuttle - very inconvenient.
review.negativeRemarks: parking difficulties
review.locationRemarks: on the far north end of the airport hotels

review.title: very good value
review.reviewText: good value for the price - has wifi, exercise room, and airport shuttle

review.title: Unhappy Camper
review.reviewText: I had a reservation and was placed in a room way in the back of their second building. I did and did not really feel safe as it was beyond railroad tracks. As for the room, it was ok. I had difficulty getting the air on and the cold water. I had to have the maintenance person come.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to go over railroad tracks to get to the second building where my room was located .. & my room was the last room on the floor way in the back.

review.title: decent hotel with nice breakfast and friendly staf
review.reviewText: when arrived at the hotel at 4 p.m the room wasn't ready but the staff apologized and got it ready in 20 minutes. the breakfast in the morning was good. parking was little difficult as there is denny's next door. overall a decent hotel to stay in for the money you spend.

review.title: SFO La Quinta
review.reviewText:
Perfectly adequate for a business trip where you just need to sleep. Nothing fancy, but it does the job.
The pool is small and outside. Since the hotel is right next to a busy warehouse, it's definitely not a highlight. Also, hotel is next to the freeway, so traffic noise is constant. But that's the case with most mid-priced hotels near SFO.
Staff is friendly and helpful. A shuttle every 30 minutes runs to the airport and BART station, which makes trips into the city easy.
review.negativeRemarks: Next to busy warehouse and freeway.
review.locationRemarks: Industrial/warehouse/hotel row near airport.

review.title: A worst experience at the La Quinta
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were lack of knowledge dealing with the cuntomer's needs.

The hotel did not provide the HOT water and AC to the rooms I had.

The hotel assistant manager did not make necessary adjustment and take the active steps to resolve the issues for the customers.

The hotel rooms need to be well-maintained. They are totaly not acceptable?

The stairway of the rear building shall be smoke-free. Lot of smoker smoked in the stairway (fire-exit stairway), Is it amazing?

What if those smoker caused the fire in the stairway?????
review.negativeRemarks: smoking, not -well maintained....

review.title: Liked everything about La Quinta Airport North!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was very convenient--free shuttle to the airport and the BART station at SFO on the hour and half-hour. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area and the best ways to get around. My room was perfectly clean, with spotless fresh linens and a comfortable bed and pillows, and plenty big with two double beds and a nice bathroom. There were no problems with water pressure or temperature. Even though close to the highway, the room was quiet. Breakfast was plentiful and well-organized. I'm giving this a 5 because my stay really couldn't have been better and it was an excellent value for the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Kept forgetting I had to allow time to walk from the north tower and across the (unused) railroad tracks to the other building for everything.
review.locationRemarks: Near a Denny's restaurant, about 10 minutes on the free shuttle to SFO and BART. About 45 minutes ($8.10) on BART then MUNI to Embarcadero area.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL NEAR AIRPORT!
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL IS LOCATED IN FRONT OF A WAREHOUSE AND RAIROAD TRACKS DIVIDE THE HOTEL IN2. BUT... THEY SERVE GREAT BREAKFAST(GREAT), IN QUANTITIES AND QUALITY. FREE PARKING. NEAR DE AIRPORT.
review.negativeRemarks: DOWNTOWN IS FAR.
review.locationRemarks: THE RR TRACKS CUT THE HOTEL IS 2. AND THERE IS A WAREHOUSE BESIDES IT.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very clear and I like it. 15 min far from downtown. Overall I recommend it and definitely will stay in it again.

review.title: Plenty fine for the price
review.reviewText: It was clean and nice for the price, and I usually stay in much nicer places. Being in a separate building across the train tracks was a little weird, but fine. Parts of the room hardware, especially in the bathroom, were worn, but functional. But, for instance the beds were quite nice and the carpet was newer, so...
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient both to the airport and to the city.

review.title: Dirty,dark room.
review.reviewText: My room was dirty and hadn't been cleaned in awhile. My 12 year old son found a man's dirty flannel shirt thrown behind a small garbage can in the room and there were 2 burned out bulbs in the lamps. There were multiple stains on the carpet and mildew in the tub. We were disgusted.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently close to the airport, the only plus.

review.title: Lousy stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was not very nice, the rooms were gross. The staff was not very friendly at all and the hotel was so noisy at night. I could hear everything in other rooms around me, the shower, an alarm, footsteps, flushing a toilet and a television etc. It pretty much kept me up throughout the night when I had to catch a flight EARLY the next morning. It just wasnt a comfortable welcoming hotel experience. And the bathroom was gross. Theres nothing around there unless you want to hike under the freeway to a Houlihans which was at a very nice holiday inn...I will be staying there next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Next to a trucking area and a Dennys

review.title: an excellent place near the airport
review.reviewText: we had no problems with this hotel. parking, breakfast, internet is included and it was clean and the staff was very nice.

review.title: Smoke filled room
review.reviewText:
The non-smoking room had a very strong smell of smoke which is the kiss of death with us.
ADA room which had been requested was not available.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Excellent airport hotel - exceeded our expectations!

review.title: Great value for SF Airport
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located a short distance from SF airport and free shuttle is provided. Parking is free which is a rarity, free wifi is appreciated but is slow. Overall great value for a short stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs remodeling.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient and close to all.

review.title: GREAT hOTEL
review.reviewText: The rooms were great, checkin was a snap (we used expedia), even had a pool and hottub which I didn't expect. cost was exceptionally resonable for what you got. Good location to fwy and local restaurants.

review.title: LaQuinta San Francisco
review.reviewText: Bed was very comfortable... pillows too. Rested well all week. Not a great neighborhood but was good for the price and sufficient for a business trip.
review.positiveRemarks: comfort of bed, free breakfast (waffles... yummy)
review.negativeRemarks: neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: This room was prepared for you!
review.reviewText:
We got to our room to find the lights on, the beds unmade and the room loaded with trash!
We called down to the office and they sent security to give us another room. Someone made a mistake.
review.negativeRemarks: Long way from the rooms to the lobby and breakfast. It would not be fun in bad weather.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Good Place to Stay in SFO
review.reviewText: This was our second time at La Quinta. The service was good, clean rooms, located close to the downtown.

review.title: Great value, would surely go back!
review.reviewText: I researched hotels quite a bit before booking. This hotel was in great location and the reviews were decent so I decided to go here. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, the people were friendly, and the breakfasts were very good. A lot of food places deliver here which was nice. Only five minutes from the airport and probably 15 minutes from the attractions downtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: nice hotel and people icky location
review.reviewText:
Hotel and staff were well above expectations.
Location location location ----

If you don't mind waking to smell of onions being processed next to your hotel room there is not a lot to complain about.
Hotel sits at corner of Airport and Produce Ave's - guess what kind of produce was being processed when I stayed there? Onions of course!
review.locationRemarks: Closer to convention center is probably better - just the other side of highway 101

review.title: Great service, great price
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in aninteresting area, I think there's a produce warehouse on the plot of land and the train tracks that seperate the two sides aren't much to look at. For the price though, you can't go wrong. THe staff was very nice and accomodating.

review.title: we will go back when we can
review.reviewText: why do you need this

review.title: a really good room
review.reviewText: booked this room at the last minute, and got a good rate, plus they allowed our cat. Not sure what the other rooms are like, but our room was great. I spend about 150 nights per year in hotels, and this one was way better than La Quinta's reputation led me to expect. Definitely recommended.

review.title: SF Hotel
review.reviewText: It is nice hotel to stay for 1 night.

review.title: "We would certainly book this hotel again"
review.reviewText:
On our 4 day mini family vacation to San Francisco we chose this hotel thru the "unplublished rates option" where we received a very good discount on our room. This was the first time we have ever used this booking option and we would definatley try it again!

As far as the hotel itself it is very conveniant to the airport and it also provides a regular 30 minute shuttle to and from the airport which allowed us to use the BART system to downtown. The hotel is somewhat dated but seems to be very popular with business people and airline pilots. The bedding and towels were pure white and the hotel provided a wonderful complimentary breakfast! The hotel staff was fantastic and even went out of their way to ensure the breakfast bar was open for us before our early morning flight!!

PS...If you plan to sight see in San Francisco you MUST buy the "Wharf Passes" available at Pier 39...best value for those who want to do a boat cruise under the Golden Gate Bridge and around Alcatraz, 2 hour double decker bus tour around the city, check out the Aquarium, "gocar" rentals etc..

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: Not bad given the location & cost. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Cheap and close to the action
review.reviewText: Convenient location, although next to railroad tract and freeway. Nevertheless, very clean, comfy beds and free parking!

review.title: Convient Place to stay when going to the city
review.reviewText: This was the cheapest place near san francisco that allowed pets. The room was updated. Our bathroom did have some mold along the edge of the shower. Nice, simple breakfast, kind of tricky to get to. Overall, I would recommend this to all travelers on a budget

review.title: Super comfy beds gave me great sleep
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Gave free shuttle rides to the airport where you can take Bart into downtown.

review.title: Great location, easy freeway access, restaurant close by
review.reviewText: Very nice room, great furnature, only negative comment was coffee grounds were left in pot one day.

review.title: Convenient Location, but beware of the railroad track
review.reviewText: Stayed here before as it's very close to SFO coming in on a later evening flight. This time, however, they booked us in a separate building north of the main hotel. The card reader was broken on the north building entrance, but there was no note, so we had to drive back to the reception to figure out how to get in the building. Once in the room, we realized the building was right next to a railroad with frequent freight trains moving by. No reference to that on the website. In the morning noticed that the bath was not properly cleaned with hairs all over. On departure I shared my disappointment at the reception, but they did not really care, certainly got no apology. We'll be looking for another hotel for our next trip.

review.title: satisfactionary
review.reviewText: good service and satisfaction ar good price

review.title: Carlos
review.reviewText: Bathroom unclean, room small and uncomfortable but good location

review.title: it was an older la quinta. i did like the location convenient to sight seeing
review.reviewText: very convient to the sight seeing i wanted to do

review.title: returntrip89
review.reviewText: Room was comfortable and clean, except for shower tile. The pool was very very cold. They had a very nice free continental breakfast.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
noisy, between train line, Highway and airplane runway
get a smoking room (booked a non smoking)

close to city and airport

review.title: Good option in South San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel location near to Airport, Highway, Caltrain and South San Francisco Downtown make La Quinta the best option in the mentioned area. The North building of the hotel is reserved for smokers and allow dogs, that is my unique negative critique, because when I reserve the room don't know that. The room space is only for four people, and no have microwave and refrigerator.

review.title: SFO Airport
review.reviewText: This is a great location for checking out downtown SFO if you have a rental car. Parking downtown is expensive and if you can take public transportation to downtown from here, then you're golden.

review.title: it was ok, But.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and serviced well, The train going bye early in the morning and late evening were a bit annoying. It would have been real nice to have an indoor pool kind of hard to swim in 40 and 50 degree temps. Not much to do after running around all day in the city, an evening swim would have been nice.

review.title: Convenient location and good value
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at this hotel, and were surprised how close it was to the main San Francisco attractions and, at the same time, how easy it was to drive back and forth between the hotel and San Francisco. The drive is only about 15 minutes, and the hotel is right off the 101. Continental breakfast was good (waffles are the best part). Our only major complained was that there was no promised Wi-Fi in our room, presumably because it was the farthest room out (counting from hotel lobby).

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay at for a night or 2. Rooms are ok. kids enjoyed the breakfast but i think they need to extend their hours..too short especially if you have kids.

review.title: get what you pay for
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I choose this hotel because we were flying in to SFO from ATL late in the evening and wanted a simple place to sleep right away. When we arrived they explained they didn't have any rooms with queen or king beds left (which we had reserved through expedia), so we were stuck to two twin beds. From the main hotel building we had to cross over railroad tracks to get to the back build, passing some warehouses and the underside of a bridge on the way. The hotel hallways were vacuumed in a long time. room was decent, I slept well, the trains won't my girlfriend up a couple times. Thought we found a deal but we got what we paid for (or maybe a little less). Won't be going back.

review.title: Needs a face lift
review.reviewText: This hotel is outdated. The showers are very low and you must bend your knees to get under them. The soap and shampoo had absolutely no smell to it. The beds are fine. The breakfast left a lot to be desired. The fruit put out was molding. Overall my experience was below average.

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: The room looked wonderful when we walked in. However when we went into the bathroom the tub/shower had mildew all over the sides. When we tried to take a shower that night there was absoultely no hot water.

review.title: Luis - nice for the price
review.reviewText: No complaints, staff was friendly, served its purpose. Getting to the hotel from the freeway is easy; getting back on the freeway not as convienient.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Price
review.reviewText: Great Hotel for us while visiting San Francisco. Very, Very Clean, Good price,Nice room and no charge for parking. Bed was ok, little too firm for us. But it's a good location for us when we drive our car to San Francisco. Close enough for us to get to the Mission area. Didn't get to enjoy the breakfast but it looked really good. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: La Quinta SSF
review.reviewText: This is a pretty old place made to be something it is not. The bathrooms are completely outdated and the rooms really small. Furniture is old and the TV is tiny. Same or better is available for less money in the same vicinity, Will not return.

review.title: I reccomend it
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before. And let me tell you, they are worth the trip! If you want to stay somewhere and are on a tight budget this is the place. Tip: If you do not have a car Take the Samtrans #292 into San Francisco!

review.title: Not the best budget option near SFO
review.reviewText: La Quinta is located very (too) close to San Francisco Airport and US-101. The room was noisy, we could hear interstate traffic all night long. Rooms are small, but clean. Parking area is completely crowded and shared with a Wendy's restaurant, we never know if we can park or not in the shared space. Breakfast is quite limited and disorganized. Staff is friendly, it is a quite acceptable option, but I believe there are better alternatives.

review.title: What a nightmare!
review.reviewText: I had reserved a room with a king size bed and I was told that they only had a room with 2 double beds. They did give me a suite room with a king bed at no extra charge. We had to drive around the corner to the other part of the hotel. We finally drug all our luggage up to the room and when we walked in the smell of the room was horrible. Walked into the bathroom and the smell hit you in the face like a ton of bricks. I noticed the top of the toilet tank was missing. I lifted the lid to the toilet seat and the toilet was full of feces.......YUCK! had to drag all the luggage back to the car and drive back around the corner to the office and they gave us another room....what a disappointment.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: for the price we paid I feel very ripped off, we had no wi fi internet which is why we booked the room and the hot tub was not working which is another reason for the choice.... bad experience...

review.title: We stay at this hotel some years ago and we had a plesant experience both times.
review.reviewText: We used to live in San Francisco and the location of this hotel was close to the airport, freeway and the City. We were able to visit friends and relatives in the bay area. It was nice to have the complimentary breakfast. We would recommend this hotel. It was clean and well attended.

review.title: Better than the streets
review.reviewText:
The Hotel was OK, parking was terrible due to free airport parking for guests, There was a howling wind that blew right through the hallway creating a loud whistling noise. The Hotel does not have a roll away bed on the premisis.
On a good note just down the street on Grand ave. there was a ton of great resturants, we ate at a differant one each night.

review.title: good price for location
review.reviewText: close to airport, clean room, great price. They are located next to some kind of produce distribution center that was very noisy all night. Ice machine not working.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The convenient location is a positive, the negative is you are right on top of US 101 which is noisy 24 hours. The room faced the highway which made it worse.

review.title: It's OK.
review.reviewText: For a short stay. Just in and out. Good, thank you!

review.title: Almost comparable to 4 star hotels in the area.
review.reviewText: Almost comparable to 4 star hotels in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice lobby, lobby breakfast could use more meats.

review.title: Not to impressed with this La Quinta
review.reviewText:
I have been to other La Quinta's before and they are in much better shape. The hotel is divided in two main buildings and the one I was staying in was across the train tracks which on monday morning made alot of noise. Also the fact that the hotel manager made sure the security guard walked me to my room after 10 PM made me feel that this was a sketchy place. I did not feel comfortable with the surroundings as there were alot of people just "hanging out" in the parking lot offering me to buy drugs on several occasions.

I would not go back to this hotel.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: We hesistantly made reservations because of a previous experience in another city. But we needed to be near the airport/highway, so we took a chance. We were pleasantly surprised! We did not expect much for the price. The clean and neat room made a good impression. Free parking was also an added value. If in the area, we would definitely try this hotel again.

review.title: Bad impressed
review.reviewText: Maintenance of the hotel really bad. We requested a king bed room and with no reason we got a double queen beds room

review.title: Thumbs Up!
review.reviewText: I very pleased by this hotel. Staff were great; friendly and professional. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable (I liked that there were 3 pillows on each). Food delivery from local eateries was offered. The only negative thing I can say is that when we went downstairs for the breakfast that was supposed to offer freshly made waffles had the waffle irons but no staff were present to produce the waffles. I was really looking forward to those waffles -

review.title: Second time there and will be happy to go agaom/
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and easily accessable. We took our dog ( a very well behaved labradoodle) and she was well excepted. Our entire party was comfortable at this hotel.

review.title: A clean hotel but poor service
review.reviewText: It's a nice and clean hotel but poor service. We have put our request for reserve rooms at the main building two days ahead, but they accepted the request and did nothing!

review.title: Good value hotel close the attractions
review.reviewText: Good place to crash for the night. Clean room, although the halls and especially stairs looked dirty. Hotel is very close to the railway, but it was quiet and the train station being close may be a plus. Parking not so good as after 11pm the hotel's lot would be full and the guard would suggest to park into the neighboring lot until 10am.

review.title: Roach hotel
review.reviewText: Deteriorated significantly from last visit. Dead roach on the bathroom floor that remained on the floor for 5 days of our visit. Bathroom door and walls looked splattered with who know's what. Yuk!!!

review.title: Will stay there again.
review.reviewText: Good shuttle service from airport. Excellent complimentary breakfast. Only thing I was not aware of is that they own two buildings. The second building is on the other side of the railroad tracks which you have to cross to get to your room if you get assigned to the second building. No big deal really! The only problem I can think of was the train that goes by starting at 5:00 AM on weekdays. Weekends no problem

review.title: Good Value for Family Vacation
review.reviewText: Room and service was as advetised. Good value for family vacation. Clean and easy access. A little noice from freeway nearby. Comfortable beds and room. Couldn't get up early enough for breakfast.

review.title: DISAPPOINTING
review.reviewText: WE WERE DISAPPOINTED ABOUT THIS HOTEL COZ MY HUSBAND SLEP ON THE FLOOR THROUGH THE WHOLE DURATION OF OUR STAY. WE PAID FOR 3PERSONS AND WE WERE EXPECTING THAT A ROLL AWAY BED WOULD BE AVAILABLE FOR THE 3RD PERSON SINCE THERE WERE ONLY 2 BEDS IN THE ROOM. THE TWIN BEDDED RM WOULD HAVE BEEN GOOD FOR A COUPLE W/KIDS WHO ARE STILL SMALL TO SHARE A BED W/A PARENT, BUT OUR SON IS ALREADY A TEENAGER AND TOO BIG ALREADY TO SHARE A BED W/ANY OF US.THE HOTEL SHUD NOT ACCEPT A TRIPLE OCCUPANCY RESVN FOR THIS RM CATEGORY SINCE THEY CANNOT PROVIDE A ROLLAWAY BED. WE ALSO HEARD FROM HTL STAFF THAT THERE ARE GUESTS WHO PAY FOR DOUBLE OCCUPANCY ONLY EVEN IF THERE ARE REALLY MORE THAN 2ADULTS IN THE RM. SO UNFAIR. WE ALWAYS MAINTAIN OUR HONESTY BY PAYING FOR 3PAX. SECONDLY,JUST AFTER CHECK IN,UPON SETTLING IN THE RM,I'VE NOTICED THAT THE TOILET BOWL HAS BEEN USED PRIOR TO OUR ARRIVAL. THE USER DID NOT FLUSH THE TOILET.HIS/HER DIRT WAS STILL THERE W/TOILET PAPER TOO.THIRDLY,THE FREE BREAKFAST IS ONLY AVAILABLE TIL 9:30AM.MOST HOTELS AVAIL BFAST TIL AT LEAST 10AM(OTHERS EVEN TIL 11AM). WE GOT TO THE BFAST AREA AT 9:40AM AND THERE WAS NOTHING ON THE TABLE. FINALLY,A DAY BEFORE WE CHECKED OUT,OUR RM WAS NOT SERVICED ANYMORE,DESPITE OUR REQUEST FOR CLEANING. AND LASTLY,THE RM IS NOT REALLY CLEANED VERY WELL. MY SOCKS GETS DIRTY WHEN I WALK WITH IT ON THE CARPET IN THE RM...HMMMM,REALLY DISAPPOINTING. LOCATION THOU WORKED WELL FOR US COZ ITS MIDWAY TO NAPA, MONTEREY, SAN JOSE AND SAN FO DOWNTOWN.

review.title: Fine.
review.reviewText: It was fine.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: A good clean hotel.

review.title: Good option near the airport
review.reviewText: I was looking for something near the airport and this turned out to be a good option.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: It was a great location to get around South San Francisco. Easy access to Highway 101.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: Nothing terribly special, it served it's purpose.

review.title: Exactly what I wanted
review.reviewText: Went to San Fran with the hopes of a great trip at a budget price. La Quinta was just what we were looking for. Very clean, great free breakfast every morning, and 10 minutes from downtown. Perfect for anyone who needs a cheaper price but still likes quality and location.

review.title: Great hotel rude staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was great the staff was rude and unhelpful.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Our supplies were not replenished daily. Breakfast was ok although toasters and waffle makers need some cleaning and parts replaced.

review.title: convenient access to/from airport
review.reviewText:
Personnel were courteous and friendly.
Breakfast provided a variety of options and was a n enexpected treat.

review.title: Perfect location. Near to the airport...!!! But far from San Francisco Downtown.!
review.reviewText:
Despite the hotel is far from San Francisco downtown, the hotel give you the oppotunite\y to take a free bus that takes you to the Bart Station...!!!

The breakfast are good for the price. Waffles, cereal, egg, fruits, yogurt, juice, bread, waffles, bagels.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Friendly and secure, staff not informative on directions to nearby attractions

review.title: Bad area
review.reviewText: The area of the hotel is really bad. It nears the train track and a warehouse. The internet connection in the room is not working.

review.title: Don't stay here. Don't even look at it.
review.reviewText: Stayed in the building by the track tracks even though I begged not to based on traveler reviews. Beds are hard as a rock. Walls are paper thin. Cable tv was fuzzy. Could get 5 channels in clear. Main building is up to date. No internet in back building. Bath fan barely came on.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: We were only in the area for a few days and only needed a place to change and sleep. It worked out good for us.

review.title: Kind and Clean. I'll stay there again :)
review.reviewText: Thanks a lot La Quinta.

review.title: Great for Animal Companions
review.reviewText: Excellent place for animals and their pets!

review.title: basically good
review.reviewText: everything is good except that one building is near the rail track, a little noisy sometimes

review.title: Extremely close to the airport ...not to much travel......
review.reviewText: Rooms were very clean and neat...Breakfast was also a plus...would stay at again.

review.title: Bad location and Internet not working and flush leaking
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is pretty bad as it is next to railway tracks and it is noisy almost till midnight. Plus the internet jack in our room was not working and it took them 1 day to figure out that it was not working. Also the toilet flush was leaking all the time. Plus our room location was not in the main building, so we had to walk outside for 5 mins crossing the railway tracks to reach to the reception.

review.title: Our Interesting Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: We had a late night check in due to plane delays and we were anxious to get to our room. When we opend the door to our room it was already occupied! Fortunately the hotel had one(!) room left but I have never stayed anywhere where they gave my reservation to someone else!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: First room hadn't been cleaned. Rooms only had a sheer curtain, no curtain to keep out morning sun. Jacuzzi was not working (it was cold).

review.title: Nice place to spend time while awaiting your flight
review.reviewText: This hotel met my every expectation and was very fairly priced. The only negative is they start breakfast 1 hour later on Saturday and I had to go elsewhere to eat because of any early flight.

review.title: GREAT PRICE!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean with pleasant and helpful staff. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room (standard with 2 queen beds) was comfortable and the beds FIRM just like I like. The only suggestion would be to invest in firmer pillows. The breakfast bar was well stocked and offered variety. We will definitely stay in the future!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Good Hotel and pleasant staff

review.title: Convenient to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: We landed at 11:30 pm from the East Coast and needed a place to stay before we hit the road the next morning. Hotel was fine for our needs.

review.title: Location is why
review.reviewText: Our room(s) were fine - we couldn't have know there would be a party of 20 somethings partying all night - so we moved at 2:30 am. Staff was very courteous. Parking was free on site. Continental breakfast was adequate and neat/clean.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other La Quinta Inn's in other states and this one was just as nice as the others. Very nice room, lots of food for the free breakfast and the perple at the front desk were very helpful.

review.title: Convenience to SFO a big factor
review.reviewText: We booked for 2 nights at this hotel on our way back from an Alaskan cruise. Convenience to SFO was a big factor in our decision because of a 6 am flight on the departure day. For this reason I would recommend but it was a medium hotel. Bedspreads needed laundering and carpet not too clean but overall bed was comfortable. They advertized breakfast but there was nothing left by 8 am only a hardboiled egg- misrepresentation on their part. Staff were friendly and helpful as was shuttle driver who was very efficient.

review.title: Budget Vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel is fine if the price is right for a short stay. Staying in the front building is reccomended. No amentities in the Hotel except neat pool and free waffles. Convenient driving to the city and airport.

review.title: GOOD EXPERIENCE,
review.reviewText: A+ CUSTOMER SERVICE.

review.title: wait to go back again, good people, great attention
review.reviewText: 1. Improve customers necessities; Example; small microwave, refrigerator in the rooms 2. The breakfast is exceptional but the daily menu need a modification some days.

review.title: Nice place for the money
review.reviewText: A bit of a commute to downtown but if you have a car, it is just next to the highway and if not, take the free shuttle to SFO (very prompt,evey half hour) and take BART to town. Great free breakfast. Rooms were very quiet. Dont bother with the pool, it is too cold in San Francisco. Lyons Restaurant is directly in front of the hotel. Prices were reasonalbe, food very good and portions large.

review.title: Would not go back
review.reviewText: checked in at 11:30 pm to catch an early flight out the next morning. Once in the room I was very surprised how low to the floor the beds were. I did not find them to be comfortable either. I kinda found the room to be creepy. Needless to say I was there to sleep. Woke up at 4:00am and was gone by 4:30. I will say that it was extremely close tot eh airport. Did not think it was worth the amount per night I paid.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. We were near the railroad tracks, but didn't hear any trains. A couple of planes did fly over, but the hotel is near SF aiport. I was disappointed that we got a smoking room, but we arrived late in the evening. They offered an air filter. The hotel is undergoing a remodel and will probably be 5's when completed.

review.title: San Fran visit
review.reviewText: Thought staying by airport would be cheap and convenient, worked out to be okay, Hotel is only 10-15 minutes from downtown, thought price was fair, has windows that I could open which I like, toilet flushed slowly which always scares me, best continental breakfast I've had - way above average. Staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great Money Saver
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfy, and the staff is great. Its a great money saver, because you get a free HOT breakfast. In room coffee pot saves trips to Starbucks. Although its a bit out of town, there are still great places for dinner in San Bruno; just a few minutes drive away.

review.title: My Jack Russell Terriers were so glad that they could come too!
review.reviewText: This was our second stay with La Quinta to attend a dog show. It is so great to be able to travel with dogs but not have to compromise on room quality. We will surely look for La Quinta first for our next dog show. As a competitor I need a restful accommodation. I appreciate being able to count on that at La Quinta.

review.title: Hotel lacking in services.
review.reviewText: Hotel needs updating and the lack of room service is a minus. My room was at the back of the hotel so I had to carry my 3 bags down the corridor to reach the elevator to go up to my room. The room itself was fine but additional services are needed. I will not be staying there again.

review.title: great location for us,
review.reviewText: Our room was nice and clean, the folks at the front desk were very helpful, the breakfast was more than we expected, especially the fresh fruit and yogurt. We were about 2 miles from the airport, so we could take the bart into town or drive. We did not have to pay for parking at the motel.

review.title: Trains in your bed
review.reviewText: Not bad - if you spend nigt in a room in the main building. Terrible in the other room - with the windows on rainroad and trains

review.title: airport shuttle 20 minutes late
review.reviewText: hotel was fine - we arrived late and left at 4 a.m. - first airport shuttle of the day was 20 minutes late which caused a little anxiety as we were catching an international flight. but it all worked out. we're not really the right people to judge as we were there such a short time - didn't even get to take advantage of their breakfast!

review.title: smokey
review.reviewText: Hotel room was smokey though I asked for a non-smoking. Of course, had to wash all clothes, clean or dirty, when I returned. Bed was not too bad on the comfort scale. If you can stay somewhere else for a little more, I would suggest it.

review.title: Room was clean
review.reviewText: Internet was extremely slow. Im talking 1996 AOL slow. TV was screwed up, picture rather dim and hard to see.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: For the price it is a very nice place to stay. The hotel hs to buildings we got to stay in the main building which was nice, the staff was very helpful and polite. the continental breakfast was just ok they kept running out of food because they would not put to much out for the guest so you would wait alot. but the actual stay was a great experience.

review.title: Can't recommend
review.reviewText: Our family stayed here for a night to visit San Francisco before going to Hawaii. I've stayed at other La Quinta hotels and been very satisfied. Not the case here. The staff at the front desk are unfriendly and incompetent. When we arrived we were told that our room wasn't ready (they were waiting for the list of cleaned rooms to come back to the front desk??)even though it was past check-in time. We went across the parking lot to the Lyons restaurant for an overpriced meal. I requested a quiet room, we recieved a room overlooking the 101. We wanted to go for a swim and called down to find out where we could get towels, lady on the phone said they would send some right up...never showed. The worst part about this stay though were the beds! It was like sleeping on a concrete slab. The sheets didn't fit properly and kept coming off exposing the mattress..YUK!! The combination of the loud highway noise and the rock hard bed made for one very unpleasant night. The cleanliness of the hotel seemed OK, except for the windows..filthy. The airport shuttle was very good. The driver was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good as well. But, the breakfast and airport shuttle didn't make up for all the other shortcomings of this hotel. There are several hotels located in the same general area to choose from. Do yourself a favor and pay a little more so you're not a walking zombie the next day.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: If you want a cheap place, you'll be satisfied. The shuttle service never arrived as promised. It is apparently shared among several hotels. YOu don't find this out til you get there. parking was a problem. room was clean but plain and boring.

review.title: a quick stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine for a quick in and out. Bed was very hard. If you arrive late, take their offer for someone to help you to your room. The hotel rooms are spread out.

review.title: Convenient for airport if leaving early
review.reviewText: Had to leave early but clean & comfortable

review.title: Good impression
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. However, some small things need attention, for example did we not have a working key for our room until the 2nd day of our stay, so we had to ask an hotel employee to unlock our room everytime, the hair dryer did not work and the cold tab of shower could not be opened until a screw was tightened. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, but breakfast staff extremely unfriendly.

review.title: It was s0-so. See below
review.reviewText: Upon my arrival I was happy that the fitness room was not occupied. Once I settled in, I proceeded to the fitness room to find a guest dominating the room with a very loud ghetto blaster & his friend leaning against a very wide open door. The guest was not exercising. He was sitting there hanging out. In short, the room was treated as "turf." Discouraged,I returned to my room. I requested a 6:15 a.m. wake-up call. I was able to work out the following morning. Aside from that, it was a pleasant stay.

review.title: Will stay there again, but----
review.reviewText: Stayed there twice on this trip, 3 days in the main building, one in the secondary building and much prefer the main building. Better than average breakfast included. Close to major hiway, next to a warehouse and train tracks, but was not bothered by eather.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I think this is a good hotel. Only one thing I don't feel good is that the room we stayed is in aother building, and we have to walk across a railway.

review.title: Great location for the price
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the free Internet access.

review.title: Great Deal for the money!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. It is close to the airport and very convenient to HWY101. The breakfast had a pretty good selection (eggs,sausage, three different types of cereal, yogurts, waffles, bagels/muffins, fruits and coffee/variety of juices) and it's at the best price -- FREE! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and plan on staying there again on my next trip back to the San Francisco area.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: It's clean and comfortable, 15 minutes from San Francisco. I would recommend to someone to stay there.

review.title: Best for the Price
review.reviewText: This was a great deal for my family. A place to sleep and have a good breakfast. The location was good to be close to the city and the airport!This is a good choose, because when you have kids and a heated pool/spa and food. You hit the jackpot!

review.title: good breakfast
review.reviewText: don't book into the north facility. it is across rail road tracks behind the front unit. Not a comfortable walk in the dark. This is very close to the freeway & train tracks, how ever the noise level was low.

review.title: Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Not a bad place to stay for a night or two. Free coffee in the lobby. Surrounded by an industrial zone, this is not a place I'd use for leisure. Shuttle from airport makes several stops at other hotels, so plan accordingly.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel has a great breakfast. A very nice staff and you can count on them for getting you any services that you might need.

review.title: Mediocre place to lay your head
review.reviewText: We were booking last minute and this was one of the only spots with availability and not outrageously expensive. Don't try to get anything from the front desk after 10:00 PM; they'll tell you they don't have a key to the housekeeping closet.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Had a good breakfast buffet, staff was very attentive. I would stay here again.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: I have stayed at several La Quinta facilities and have always been satisfied. The San Fransciso facility was clean, comfortable and the staff was courteous.

review.title: Retrun customer
review.reviewText: Easy on/off access to Hwy 101, good parking, have used this hotel twice - consistently good value

review.title: Your average stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was your average stay near an International Airport. It was in a fairly descent neighborhood and not too difficult to find, just off I5. However, in all honesty, next time I need to stay near SFO I'll may look for a differnet motel (more for curiosity of what's there). Although I'm not opposed to staying there again.

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: I was sad when I went home and had to make my own breakfast again.

review.title: Nice Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Las Quinta San Francisco is a decent airport hotel. We stayed there one night before going to Europe. Good room, nice breakfast and reasonable price. The personal in the reception were very helpful assisting us with various problems. Nice Lyons restaurant was only a short walk away. buffet

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Due to a glitch in air traffic control, we landed in San Francisco really late. When we arrived at our hotel, we were given a room in a seperate building some distance from the main hotel. We literally had to go to "the other side of the tracks" as there were railroad tracks between our building and the main building. It was not in a great neighborhood to walk to late at night.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Only complaints, the room was on the other side of the railroad tracks, not in the front buildings? Don't know the reason for this. A Non-smoking room, but the bathroom had a very strong smell, I believe it was the shower curtain. I did enjoy the quietness very much, good breakfast, close to airport and freeway, cleaningless.

review.title: A one night stay...
review.reviewText: The staff was courteous and the hotel was located conveniently close, but not too close to the airport. On a scale of 1/10 the comfort of the beds was a 5. Although the rates per night were very reasonable. We'd stay again when in that area.

review.title: Nice motel
review.reviewText: clean room,convinience location, nice breakfast buffet.

review.title: Very good value.
review.reviewText: This is an excellent choice if you need to overnight near SFO. Clean, comfortable, nice breakfast, roomy, in room coffee, shuttle bus, etc.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Highway noise on the East side noticeable.

review.title: Good choice near San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: Very convenient, comfortable and reasonably priced hotel near the San Francisco airport. Enjoyed the free shuttle service and a very complete and good breakfast included in the room rate. Too rainy and cool to use the outdoor pool. A good choice for a business traveler or anyone needing to be near the airport.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. My only complaint would be a lack of parking. We ended up having to park at the restaurant parking accross the lot. Room was great, staff helpful, breakfast is always a bonus to La Quinta's.

review.title: Everything's good except for Breakfast
review.reviewText: I cannot believe the kind of breakfast they have. The breakfast area gets pretty crowded in the morning and all they have for hot breakfast selection is waffles. There is no scrambled eggs or potatoes, etc. The bagels are not good. You do find cold boiled eggs, cereals and bread (general and whole grain) with assorted spreads...yes, some fruits and yoghurt as well. I wish they improve on breakfast. I'm really pleased with the room service, service at the lobby and overall cleaniness of the hotel.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Reserved through Expedia, excellant service and price.

review.title: OK for overnight
review.reviewText: Used this hotel just to sleep in before flying out of SFO the next morning. Free shuttle was on time; room was fine but nothing out of the ordinary. Great for just an over-night instead of staying in SF for twice as much.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel that is far/close enough from the airport (you dont hear any air traffic, plus, has free shuttle access to and from), super close to the 101fwy (but cant hear the traffic), and within 10 minutes drive to downtown (to the warf, unionsquare and such). The room (KING) was more than adequate in size and ameneties. Extremely large bathroom. Wonderful continental breakfast. Free parking. Will definitely be staying here again.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: So-so for the purpose. Pleasant manager.

review.title: La Quinta @ SFO
review.reviewText: Nice enough. Parking a little sparse. Highway noise on East side noticeable.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: I think La Quinta Inn is a very good hotel for a short stay but in my opinion the staff should pay attention to the breakfast which does not impress to foreigners. Some real bread, fresh coffea or tea, youghurt, cereals, real juice and fresh fruits should be brought instead of that muffin fluffin sugarsweet stuff that is served now.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. There is a main building and another building in the back which you can drive too. The hair dryer didn't work but there was a maintainance form in the room which I filled out in the morning and when we arrived back to the room in the afternoon it was fixed. The room was very clean and quiet. There is internet connection in the rooms but since I didn't have a computer that wasn't useful. They don't have a business center but when I went to the front desk to ask if I could print out my airline tickets the manager allowed me to do this on her computer. I felt that was going above and beyond. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Excellent Rest
review.reviewText: The room was clean and presentable. Next to the freeway but not noticeable. Allowed for a great sleep. Located in area near small shopping center and BART station.

review.title: Your basic airport hotel...
review.reviewText: Meet most of the conditions you need for an airport hotel. However the so called Hi speed internet access was more like dial-up speeds. Very sloooooow. Had one of the better complimentary breakfasts bars. No meat, but eggs and waffles available besides your basic cereal, sweet rolls and bagels. Overall, adequate.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Close to airpoty. Shuttle was easy to access and on time.

review.title: Very Good.
review.reviewText: We stayed just for the night and then headed to SF. They picked us up from the Airport with shuttle. Quite a selection for breakfast. Best value for the buck.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel good accomadations

review.title: The pillows needs to be better.
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean. I could not close the window shades. The breakfast were great. The pillows was not comfortable.

review.title: Nice clean room, would recommend
review.reviewText: Nice clean room, would recommend

review.title: Very Good, great Location
review.reviewText: The only real complaint is that the beds were not of good quality. Everything else, was excellent. If I am in that part of the country, I will stay there again. And the price is hard to beat.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel Value
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel many times and have always been extremly satisfied. Ample free parking and you can be in downtown San Francisco in fifteen minutes.

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: will definitely go back, clean with friendly staff

review.title: Clean and well maintained
review.reviewText: -Clean and well maintained -High Speed Internet included in room rate -Friendly Staff -Breakfast selection more extensive than other hotels

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed for one night on a leisure trip to San Francisco. The price was right and the location was good. Just close enough to be about a 10 min drive from the heart of downtown and far enough to be priced well for what we paid. The room was very clean and cozy. There are actually two seperate buildings to the hotel. I stayed in the rear building past the railroad tracks(sounds scary and loud but it wasn't). This was far enough from the warehouse so I didn't hear anything. I would recommend this building if your worried about the noise from warehouse. The only noise I heard was from the occasional departing jet traffic from SFO. Not a big deal in my opinion. The walls seem thick enough to block out the noise from our neighbors. 

The hotel room itself was very clean and our non-smoking room did not have any odor at all. Everything worked and the staff was friendly. I did not have the continental breakfast so I can't comment on how that was... I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind driving 10-15 minutes into SF and getting the most for your money at a hotel that was nice and clean with free parking too. Beats staying in some hotel in town(which I've done before) that cost more and is cruddy with no free parking.

review.title: Great hotel for a great price
review.reviewText:
Overall, we are very pleased with this hotel.
Complimentary breakfast was excellent. Our only complaint is that, if you are late for breakfast, not much food is left to eat.

review.title: Very good value, for the price
review.reviewText: One of the less expensive hotels in the area, but included a clean and comfortable room with internet access and breakfast.  Breakfast was not great, but acceptable.

review.title: Great "airport" hotel
review.reviewText:
A great place to stay if you plan to fly out of San Francisco.  
To be located next to an extremely busy major highway, the room was surprisingly quiet. 
What a continental breakfast!  Usually a variety of muffins is the fare, but this hotel had eggs, sausauge, waffles and fruit as well(at 6:15a.m.)

review.title: Close, but no noise
review.reviewText: Within a short 5 minute shuttle ride you are at the hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms and a delightful breakfast.  From the hotel the BART station is a quick 5 minute ride.  Utilizing Muni bus service one can easily explore San Francisco with worring about high parking fees and almost non existent street parking.

review.title: Nice location; free breakfast very good; plan to stay there again.
review.reviewText: Hotel very clean, location good, free breakfast very nice, price right.

review.title: Great for the tired SFO traveler
review.reviewText: Solid hotel at an attractive price.

review.title: a good way to have a room away from home
review.reviewText: Best treatment we had in this place.Good rooms & affordable price.My family & I are pleased with the services & breakfast is good.Thanks a lot.
